Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a couple of days...”
Reviews.Author: scrivic
Reviews.Content: First, let me start by saying that the ONLY purpose of this hotel was to have a place to stay prior to my cruise. I would not recommend staying here for an extended vacation as it's not beachfront and it's quite a hike from Old San Juan. Hotel check-in was easy but there were long lines for check-out. (Had to check out to have a fee removed from my bill.) Rooms were clean, spacious, carpeting could use a deep clean but otherwise, fine. Hotel is near two Walgreens - in case you forgot something on your cruise. Many restaurants are within walking distance but Old San Juan is about an hour's walk away. (Cabs are very expensive and I think they were $20 to get back from OSJ to the hotel.) Take the bus if you have the time. Did not use the casino but walked through it. No craps table but they did have roullette, blackjack and slots. Smoking is not allowed in hotel or casino but smokers can go outside or smoke off their patio. Did not eat at the restaurant...noticed prices were a bit expensive. Cab from this hotel to Pan Am Pier is about $15 (2 adults, 2 bags.) Cost per night was worth me staying here pre-cruise.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: San Salvador, San Salvador, El Salvador
Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Laura A
Reviews.Content: Travel to Puerto Rico in February and stayed at this hotel while passing through San Juan, the truth about feeding leave much to be desired because the breakfast was quite restricted mostly we were traveling with children and the snack was exactly the same sandwich the 3 days of our stay (not a very good one), the cleaning was not very good and to finish the day before our departure there was a theft from the person in the room next door, according to what we understood by the staff ... . not return to stay there. But to be fair the location was excellent...

Reviews.Title: “A Little tired, A Little Worn”
Reviews.Author: lisa222
Reviews.Content: This hotel is showing its age. My room (833) had a battered door which had a large gap at the top and bottom, letting all hall noise flow right in. The bottom of the door stuck on the carpet, so it did not close without effort. Off the elevator lobby wan an area where old chairs and tables were strewn about--just looked tacky. On the plus side, no silly "resort fees." Location in Condado is great, with easy access to resto's, bars, and drugstores. A 15-minute bus ride to Old San Juan. The beach is lovely. Can't comment on the Casino because I did not try it. The number of vagrants in Condado seems to have increased quite a bit in the past few years. They are more aggressive in soliciting, although probably harmless. Even the cab drivers waiting in front of the hotel were aggressive (I waited every morning to be picked up by a work colleague.)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for price, near shops and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: jm1872a
Reviews.Content: I REALLY wanted to like this hotel as it had a lot going for it. Reasonable prices; good location; and good amenities. However, the staff of this hotel really turned me against the Radisson brand... in Puerto Rico at least. If you're a traveler who likes spending a lot of time in the hotel, you will be disappointed with the Radisson Ambassador. However, since this hotel is smack in the middle of Condado, you will be able to explore and see much more of San Juan than you might otherwise would. This hotel is old, and I don't mean old in a charming way, but old in a "this was once a great hotel... in 1962" way. Everything has this 70's/80's kitsch that I can't really put my finger on. It's also pretty clear what this hotel is about - providing somewhat cheap rooms for tourists as well as a gambling establishment for nearby residents. There is NO lobby in this hotel - just a casino, which was obviously shoehorned into the hotel's 1st floor. One day for breakfast we decided to try the hotel restaurant - do avoid at all costs. Our ridiculously overpriced breakfast was little more than stale muffins, donuts, and pastries (at least the edible part of the meal). There were also eggs and sausage, but I couldn't stomach those items. I did manage to visit the spa, but was grossly disappointed. I had made an appointment for 6 PM (the last slot of the day) because I wanted to be out in time to grab dinner and drinks afterward. I showed up on time, but still had to wait nearly 30 minutes. The massage and facial I received were brutal. My face was red for over a day and I somehow left the massage in more pain. Definitely avoid! Probably the worst part of this hotel was the casino. My group was treated very poorly by the casino employees and I was shocked at how unwilling to be hospitable they really were. Normally, at the tables, servers will bring you any assortment of drinks and snacks that you might want (after all, you are throwing your money at them). I ordered a Cuba libre (nothing complicated: rum, coke, and lime) and they acted as if I was asking for the key to the casino vault! I was kindly informed by the pit boss that all they could offer me was ONE local beer(the kind that's $1 a bottle at any outside bar) even though I had been sitting at the table for a couple of hours that night and the nights before. This really miffed me as I had seen other patrons (supposedly locals) order drinks like Pina Coladas and Daiquiris and offered snacks and sandwiches. Lesson for hoteliers: Don't think you can treat visitors poorly... especially the ones with internet connections.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for pre/post cruise stop over!”
Reviews.Author: LadyHeineken
Reviews.Content: First off, I read ALL of the reviews before booking our one night stay. This was our first cruise leaving from PR so we opted to fly down a day before having to board the ship. I made sure to have a printed copy of my reservation confirmation so checking in was smooth sailing. We received a discount card to use at the hotels restaurant and a free drink coupon redeemable at either the restaurant or bar. You can tell this use to be two separate hotels, the decor was a little out dated but the location cannot be beat. The casino was closed because of Good Friday but that was fine with us! We were a couple of blocks away from great restaurants and litterally steps away from the beach!! It was so cool. Everything we needed was in walking distance, i.e. Walgreens for a couple of last minute necessities as well as Baskin and Robins for a vacation kick off treat. All in all I would definitely stay here again if I was crusing out of PR, it was more than adequate for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, older property.”
Reviews.Author: gayokwithme
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, clean rooms. Nothing to write home about, but not bad! Comfortable bed! beware of taxis from aiRpoRt. it is 18 $flat rate, plus one dollar a bag. No matter how many people in van

Reviews.Title: “good location, decently priced”
Reviews.Author: dahead
Reviews.Content: Located in the condado area of san juan, about 15minutes from the airport. It is right on ashford ave, which offers high end stores between the tourist gift shops. There r also plenty of restaurants and bars to choose from all within walking distance. Because there are a few hotels on and around the avenue, there are always people walking around so you feel safe walking around at night. There are always cabs available as soon as you walk out the door. Both times i stayed there, it was part of the ambassador club. With that i also got access to the club which offered a free buffet style breakfast with all the basics - oatmeal, bread, bagels, pastries, fruits and yogurts. If u r a coffee drinker use the coffeemaker in your room or go the starbucks two blocks away as the buffet breakfast offers crappy coffee dispense from a coin machine straight out of a 1970 hospital. They aso offer light snacks @ 5.30 but i was never there at that time. I also got a coupon for a free drink and a coupon to use at the casino. The hotel itself has been renovated but you cant hide that its been around. The rooms are clean, staff helpful and pleasant. For those looking to be right on the beach this is not your hotel as it is a block or so from the beach. There is a small and clean rooftop pool and a small fitness center. There is also a salon and restaurant. The food is not bad there but the portions could b bigger given their prices. The casino and lounge areas are also small. As a club carson member u also get free wifi in your room. This hotel is for people who don't want to spend all their money on a room. Its okay, offers good deals to stay there and is a short ride away from isla verde, old san juan, pinones and the big shopping mall - plazas de las americas which has over 200 stores.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my purpose”
Reviews.Author: Bev046
Reviews.Content: I needed to make a quick trip to San Juan on a family matter, so didn't have much time to find a hotel; price and location were important. I ended up here, and it was perfect for this purpose. I was upgraded to a two-room suite, so I had a place to sleep separate from a place to do work when I wasn't dealing with the family matter. It was all comfortable and clean, and quite pleasant. And it's in the middle of the Condado section, with plenty of restaurants. I'm not a fan of casinos, and this had a lively one, but it didn't interfere with the quiet I needed. The parking was free with the hotel, always a good thing, and so was the Internet. The one meal I had at the hotel restaurant was mediocre at best, but the fact that it was open late was important to me. It's a big hotel, and not one I would normally stay at with my husband on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice after long day of travel”
Reviews.Author: 67cuda
Reviews.Content: Stayed March 17th for pre-cruise stay. There were 3 couples and we all asked for quiet rooms and we were all upgraded to 7th floor. Everything was clean, quiet and comfortable. Was much better than I ever thought it would be. Front desk was helpful on everything too. There are a few places around for quick food and also a drug store that have everything including wine, soda and bottled water that we purchased as we were allowed to take those on the cruise.

Reviews.Title: “after cruise”
Reviews.Author: Sharon H
Reviews.Content: Arrived around 11:00 am and room wasn't ready but I was then pre-registered and they tag my bags & held them so we could go and explore San juan. There was no big wait for check-in.The staff was pleasant & polite. After we returned around 5:00 I was handed my key card and Jimmy took our bags up to the room. It was spacious and clean & the balcony overlooked palm trees. When I discovered the hairdryer wasn't working properly, they immediately gave me one to use. There is a nice little bar on site playing music, and just down the street was a pizza shop with a bar that was great.We didn't get breakfast so I don't know how it is.I would definitly stay here again. I'm glad i didn't listen to all the bad reviews. I think some people try to find things to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms.”
Reviews.Author: doconyc
Reviews.Content: Room was dirty. Maid walked in on me dressing even though do not disturb was up/ on the door. Terrible views. Super scratchy sheets. Toilet did not flush properly (three flushes for a normal flush). Fan in bathroom did not work. Small beach down the road. Casino loud, cheap and unavoidable in order to get to rooms. Not much security/easy access to elevators from loud casino (which is open to public but frequented by an older 60+ local crowd). Back elevator to pool has a nasty, urine-looking stain on ceiling panels which would be very inexpensive to replace. And the stain has clearly been up there awhile. Rooftop pool is nice but not enough to bring me back. Basically there is poor hotel management going on here. Would have checked out but stuck as we prepaid through Priceline. We were on the second floor, which is older and not as recently renovated. We heard the upper floors were better. But we checked out the renovated floors (had to have been renovated in the 80s). The halls look like art deco meets 80s trump tower meet the shining. Creepy cheap decadence. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: martyap
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to the Radisson and we could not have been more pleased. The rates are reasonable and the location on Ashford Avenue is safe and very convenient. Every associate we came in contact with from Amanda at the front desk, Jimmy the bellman and Mildred Rodriguez the general manager could not have been nicer or more accommodating. The rates were perfect for our pre cruise visit and we booked the Ambassador Club rate which comes with breakfast up in the penthouse and late afternoon snacks. A great way to start your day and equally refreshing after a day of sightseeing. The rooftop pool is an added feature that makes the Radisson a fantastic choice. The public bus outside the hotel takes you into Old San Juan for 75 cents and there is an abundant choices of restaurants within walking distance. We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Erin J
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after canceling our reservation at the Atlantic Beach Hotel. We were presently surprised to find a huge, clean room for a good price (we got a discount with AAA). They even let us check in 5 hours early. The pool is nice and the staff at the pool bar is very helpful. The beach is one block away in front of the Marriott. It's a public beach with beach chairs and everything, which was perfect. The casino is about average, but we didn't utilize it much. The sleep number bed was extremely comfortable. Our safe in our room was broken, but the security came and fixed it once we called. Right near 2 Walgreens and tons of restaurants in a very safe area. Service was good and overall we had a great experience. We would come back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but no pool”
Reviews.Author: Angel4371
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was great, and the room was comfortable and the king size bed was inviting and so comfortable. The only thing I thought was missing was a swimming pool and jacquzzis.

Reviews.Title: “great location, easy access around the city”
Reviews.Author: qtgayle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson San Juan iwith 5 friends for my bday and It was a great experience. Check in at first was kinda tricky since the card holder didnt make the flight so we had to pay cash and a deposit on the room. But other than that everything else was good. The casino has slots and many diffenerent tables to play at. small lobby but alot of informative desks and people to help out if you get kost, need a taxi, or want to sign up for an excursion. We had a kings suite with a divided living room with a pull out queen sofa, 2 tvs, nice size bathroom, balcony, fridge and a free safe. The roof top pool was ok. not to may people actually went into the pool, but rather just chilled at the tables and conversed. The only negative thing I have to say about the hotel are the locations for the ice making machines. I was kinda scaried going into them because they looked like old janitor closets. Other than that its a nice hotel and great location for transportation arond the city. $12 per day for parking wasnt bad at all. They have serveral restuarants including authentic puerto rican food and fast food jionts within walking distance. All in all I got a great AAA discount and would stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok.”
Reviews.Author: nuyoricanone
Reviews.Content: We arrived a little dirty since we just finished a rappelling and zip lining tour (got us a few looks). We were told that check in for us was at the Penthouse level (we felt special). Once we got the to the penthouse level for the Ambassador Club (we are not members but got a special online rate for this trip) it seemed so out of place for Puerto Rico, very "businessy" and cold. After receiving our keys we went to the 6th floor, the doors opened and we thought ok, not bad. When we got to the room we were disappointed. The bathroom had no ventilation and was unbearably hot after showers with a group of four. We had no curtain to block the porch light and when we asked housekeeping to look into it, they hung up a weird curtain behind the sheer one which we thought odd. On one of the beds the sheet did not fully cover the mattress and during the night would slip off. It was not our favorite place during our trip. The positives: The location was close to several stores, restaurants, and a block from the beach. The staff was overall friendly. Overall, just average and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Strictly Average but Convenient”
Reviews.Author: VancouverTripper
Reviews.Content: Ideal for pre-cruise hotel due to its location, but it felt very crowded around the reception area. We arrived around midnight after a long day flying to discover they had overbooked the hotel by fifteen (15) rooms. Then they found our reservation and we were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room (mini two room suite) and the cleanliness. The casino entertainment was entertaining and it was close proximity to the beach. Not the warmest of welcomes mainly because we were such late arrivals and they were so busy. I would only recommend for convenience as an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “An overall unpleasant hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: Farende
Reviews.Content: The check in procedure was very painful as I had booked through Expedia and not printed out the confirmation. Although they had our reservation in their system and I had could show the Expedia confirmation e-mail on my phone, we could not be checked in without the paper copy from Expedia. I have never come across this problem before and it took a long time to sort it out. The room was tired with a hard mattress and a noisy air-conditioner and the garbage truck that came along to empty the garbage from across the street at 5 am in the morning was hard to ignore. On the positive side, the area is great and there are several good restaurants in the neighborhood. Next time we come to Puerto Rico we may stay in the same area but definitely in a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK,NOT GREAT”
Reviews.Author: maizie253
Reviews.Content: The approach to this hotel and the registration area don't "show well"...the main level is dominated by the casino...so one shouldn't expect more.The art deco motif on the upper floor areas is a bit heavy but the suite was fine.The penthouse deck,pool and fitness area are well maintained.The continental breakfast isn't much and the instant coffee out of a machine is bad.The area is fine with retail,restaurants and bars.It is a short taxi ride to Old San Juan which is outstanding.Room was a bit pricy but overall our stay was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value”
Reviews.Author: Joseph S
Reviews.Content: Hotel nothing more than average. Business center has 3 computers for guest use, of which only 1 was working. Stayed two days and no effort was made to fix this problem. WiFi was sporadic. Guest information book in room offers more information about the casino than any other services in the hotel, such as pool hours, restaurant hours, fitness and business centers. Charged an additional $100 "incidental" fee to my credit card at check-in. Told this is standard policy! You already have my credit card, so why the charge? Not a good value for the price. Would not stay there again. Too many other places in the same area!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money, better value out there.”
Reviews.Author: rjrmia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK, nothing to brag about. Staff was less than friendly and or helpful. When checking in, they intructed us to check in the the "Ambassadors Desk" in the Penthouse area, however was less than a penthouse feel. The included WIFI worked sporatically and had difficult time getting on to the network as well as staying on. I informed the front desk, and they just said they would look into this issue. The breakfast included was not very good, just breads, muffins and coffee, tea or Juice. I will probably not stay here again unless cannot find another better option.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location & service-Great value”
Reviews.Author: SBinPhx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 2/9/12 thru 2/12/12 in room 535. Check in was quick and smooth. We got a King size bed as requested. The room was clean with enough space and storage for both of us. The bed was comfortable, and all linens were in very good condition. Everything in the room worked: hair dryer, TV, remote control, lights, AC, etc. The plumbing was excellent: plenty of hot water, excellent water pressure, no leaky faucets and drainage was fast. The elevator was roomy, quick and safe. Plenty of ice down the hall. Didn't hear any noise from the street or other guests. We rented a car and used the hotel's valet parking because it's convenient and reasonable. It isn't a beach hotel, but there is beach access around the corner. We went to other beaches on the island, so it wasn't a big issue for us. We got a view of the parking lot and HVAC equipment, but that's no big deal either because we didn't spend a lot of time in the room. The location is fantastic. We did a lot of walking along Ashford avenue where you can find lots of very good restaurants, bars and shops. The weather was perfect and the breeze from the ocean was so refreshing. The hotel staff was friendly, helpful and polite without being snotty. Very cheerful atmosphere in the lounge on Saturday night with the live music and the locals dancing salsa. The hotel's breakfast buffet is a bit pricey, but very convenient if you want an early start. Our stay at this hotel was the smoothest part of our trip. It is a good value for the location in San Juan although to be fair, we did use like 30000 points from previous stays at other Radisson locations. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie L
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. The room was clean when we checked in and we were able to adjust the air conditioner. I'm rating the hotel as average because it was not beachside and the casino didn't have craps (we had to go to the Marriott for both.) Also, the pool was on the rooftop and not landscaped like many Caribbean hotel pool decks you may see. But the hotel did fine as a place to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: RiverRainbow
Reviews.Content: We'd reserved a room at this hotel because six of our friends had already booked for a three-day pre-cruise stay. After reading the negative reviews on Tripadvisor we were apprehensive about staying there. Happily, on our arrival we were treated well and stayed in a very spacious and comfortable room. The rooftop pool and bar were particularly nice. The staff were very accomodating without being overbearing. The location was great - it was close to the beach, lots of restaurants were nearby and the bus stop to get to Old San Juan was just outside the hotel. We were more than satisfied with our stay, as were the three other couples we were travelling with.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but not a beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: Renee P
Reviews.Content: We had a great time but I did not like the beach, the water with the waves is dangerous. A taxi driver told us that some tourists sunk every year. The service at the hotel was very good. The room comfortable and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: alaskalangs
Reviews.Content: Stayed with this hotel prior to / and after cruise. Upon initial check in was not greeted warmly or offered luggage assistance with our many bags. They frequently offered and pushed for taxi use (many many were outside at all times) when a 2 minute walk to the bus saved $20 each way to just about everywhere we wanted to go. Upon return from cruise - we were very early before check In - they did secure our bags ... But instead of telling us it would be Several Hours (8) before we would even be checked in - we were encouraged to be on the "waiting list for early room". As we waited essentially in the Lobby for those hours an Entire day was wasted. Not nice people, not helpful people, and I would not encourage business

Reviews.Title: “4 days on vacation”
Reviews.Author: Habaman
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel situated on the main street near the beach. It's not near Old San Juan (maybe 1 hour walk) but it is well situated in Condado with good restaurants nearby (e.g. Jam Rum Bar). The ambassador rooms are nice with plenty of space for two people. For the ambassador room is included snacks at 6pm and a breakfast. These are ok but not delicious. The hotel has also a good rooftop poolarea, a small gym and a casino with plenty of slotmachines. Although the hotel was quite good, next time I'm going to take a hotel from Old San Juan since the area seems to be more fascinating. However Old San Juan doesn't have any beaches (?) so it would be a hard decision. P.S. The wireless didn't function very well during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: shonie29
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of the reviews prior to my arrival to Puerto Rico a couple weeks ago. I thought I was going to be in a dump! However, I was pleasantly surprised. It isn't a 5 star hotel but the rooms were clean the staff were so nice and friendly! The hospitality spoke volumes. My only issue was that our tub was a little grimey when we first arrived and the hotel restaurant's floor was very dirty. Other than that I did not have any major issues with this hotel and wouldn't mind staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay before the cruise”
Reviews.Author: RandyS32
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here one nite before our cruise. Nice little casino to have some fun. Walking distance to restaurants, and shops. Beach nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for a pre-cruise stay.”
Reviews.Author: sbitt72
Reviews.Content: Just stay for 1 night pre-cruise. Good location, near by grocery to stock up on supplies. Small casino and entertainment in lobby area. Good value and OK amenities.

Reviews.Title: “2 Night stay before Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Stephluvs2travel
Reviews.Content: The room looked nothing like the pictures on the site it was a bit outdated. The only perk was it was relatively close to the beach. The food around wasnt so great. Check in and Check out were really slow and the lady had a bit of an attitude. There was a dirty bandaide in the room when we first checked in . The casino - eh .

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: owltmaz
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting San Juan for a short business trip or overnight before a cruise this hotel is a decent choice. Its big and a little dated, but the room was clean and service acceptable. Casino is small, but had $5 blackjack all night on the weeknight I was there. Getting a seat was not a problem. Lots of good restaurants within walking distance. Check out Pinky's for good sandwiches and breakfast. Found a good value rate on line. Sleep number bed.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocrity in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: DavePorter090
Reviews.Content: The casino on the ground floor is the money-maker. Check-in service was poor. The room was barely clean enough to stay in, and the carpeting was worn with ripples deep enough to trip on. The swimming pool was clean enough, but poorly maintained - the underwater lights had the alarming habit of falling out of their sockets and into the pool. The only bright spot was the penthouse hideaway on the roof next to the pool. Staff there were friendly, helpful, and determined to please, regardless of the inadequacies of management and budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and affordable during low peak”
Reviews.Author: JennyDiaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Radisson for a few days and was pleasantly surprised. Rooms were clean and roof top pool was decent. Location is ideal for walking around during the day. There are shops and restaurants in very close proximity, which is a very good thing since dining (esp. late night dining) is limited in the hotel. Hallways need some updating and big box tv's should be replaced with LCD/LED tv's.

Reviews.Title: “Old and dirty”
Reviews.Author: AHSU18
Reviews.Content: We got the room from Priceline for 85 + tax/surcharge. The first room they gave us, the bathroom was leaking right above the toilet. (yellow color, very disgusting!) They gave us another room right away. But the sheets seems to have mold that you can't wash off. The room is big, but very old, everything is very out of date, even the TV is old and not very clear. Internet is free but very slow. This is a great location to many restaurants and there is a wallgreen nearby. When we check out, the hotel charge us another 11 dollar for TAX. I don't know if that's a standard charge for all hotel in here or not. But anyway, I will not stay in this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Average sums this up”
Reviews.Author: waltermelon
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more from the radisson. The neighborhood was nice - lot of shopping and walking around. The hotel itself however disappointed. The rooms were older, which is fine. I dont even mind the noise that some other reviewers mentioned. What i did not appreciate though was the shoddy maintenance. There was a used coffee cup sitting next to the coffee maker, along with an empty coffee pack.The stopper in the tub was broken so water kept accumulating in the bath tub and I had the nasty feeling I was standing in someone elses bath water while I was taking a bath. A call to housekeeping took care of that fast enough, but when I stay at a Radisson property, I don't expect to walk into a room that looks like someone else just walked out of it. For the pluses: the rooftop pool is very nice. the exercise room is well equipped. Staff is friendly, and like I mentioned earlier, nice neighborhood to walk around in. If you're visiting with family and are going to spend more time in Old San Juan - stay in Old town. Its worth the few extra bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel but nice - very big rooms ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: tylerrd
Reviews.Content: We got two rooms for $75/night through priceline bidding. We stayed one night after a cruise. The hotel was not the most fancy hotel but it was very nice and the rooms were very large. The linens were all high quality and the furnishings were okay. Internet was free which was really nice! ! ! We enjoyed swimming on the roof top pool.

Reviews.Title: “3 rooms in two days!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoRobDT
Reviews.Content: OMG, where to start...from check-in to check-out the best approach. I have been to San Juan several times and this time I decided to stay here as I have stayed at several Radisson hotels in Canada and expected a certain standard--the most appealing being that the complete hotel was designated as non-smoking. Check-in was a breeze and soon I was in the elevator and in a standard room. It was huge (photos will show-- Rooms 1 and 3 were the same layout and design), clean, comfortable beds plus a balcony. The view was not great but still it was nice to sit outside. I also like the fact that the AC unit was new and built into the wall for easy control (this would play a bigger role later). I unpacked and then decided to put my valuables in the safe and it would not work. Thinking that I was doing something wrong I called the front desk and they were very prompt with sending up a maintenance person. He was not able to fix it so within a few minutes the day guest services manager was there to apologize and to give me a key to a suite one floor below. I packed up again and moved to the suite. It was large, had a living room and a nice little hallway to provide separation to the bedroom. There was a balcony there too with even a worse view, but it was fine. I did notice that the suite seemed to be in a section of the building that might be older because the furniture and carpets did not seem to be so fresh and new as the standard room that I was in. With a working safe and being unpacked again, off I went to have dinner and explore. Issue: the one thing that was different in the suite as opposed to the standard room was the HVAC system was not individual like the standard rooms but instead a system of ductwork. Normally, this would not be an issue, however around 3am I woke up because I could not breathe---second hand smoke was seeping into the ventilation. I went to the front desk but at that hour there was nothing they could do so there I was at 3:30 walking on the beach alone---it was either personal safety vs not being able to breathe. The next morning though, to give the hotel credit, they were very open to me moving back to a standard room. Though I thanked them for the flexibility I still had to voice concerns that a published non-smoking hotel would allow smoking. The answer I got was that they needed visual proof that someone was smoking in the room. I completely disagree with that and the approach taken by hotels eleswhere is that if there is the smell of smoke in the room, visual proof or not, a cleaning fee would be added to the credit card. It seems to work everywhere else but not in San Juan it appears. Thankfully, I was only there for a few days and went off to Miami. I would consider this place again but only on the condition that I could have a written confirmation that I would be placed in a standard room with the individual AC, not the duct system, so that I would be able to breathe again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but average for cost”
Reviews.Author: Svenara
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the excellent neighbourhood of Condado in San Juan. It is exactly a block away from a public beach (Hotel does not have a private beach). The hotel is also conveniently next to a lot of eating places such Chicago Uno, Burger King, Starbucks and Pinky's. The hotel is also close to a pharmacy which is an added advantage. Since I am a solo traveller, safety in this region was not a problem. Some of the very best hotels in San Juan are located on the same street as Radisson. Now coming the hotel itself, it was average for the cost paid. The carpet was old and it felt unclean. I smelled strong disinfectants in the bathroom. The bathroom as such was clean. On day one when I checked in, the bathroom was stocked with a shampoo, conditioner, and two soaps. Since I have long hair, I managed to finish my shampoo on day one itself and noticed that the hotel had not replenished the tolieteries the next day. I specifically asked the hotel cleaning staff for a shampoo and they told me that they were out of supply and it will take one week for them to be brought in. The bed was comfortable and the sheets were clean. The TV was old and there wasnt much to watch (unless you paid it). The room had a hair dryer (took me a while to plug in) as it was rusty!! On day 3, all of a sudden, while I was sleeping, the room alarm started ringing (5.15 am). I had never touched the alarm and neither had requested for a wake up. That was definitaely upseting as I had a long night prior. Also the rooms were not at all sound proof. I could hear the next room's TV and all the people who would walk by. If noises arent an issue or if you will stay out for most of the time at your hotel, this isnt a bad choice. I would personally not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You need to aviod this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dave77622
Reviews.Content: I normally do not comment on hotels but I felt this one posed as an exception..Where to begin...Room had damage, linens wre torn, no baggage carts, no luggage assistance, hot water was a 50/50 proposition each morning, air conditioning was either full blast or none at all. Not up to what I would say is Radisson type standards.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Steven V
Reviews.Content: Hotel carpet is old and smells a bit moldy but the worst is the service. The phone in our room would not work and neither would the one in the lobby. You had to wait in line with the people checking in to use the phone and the wait is always about an hour or more. When we checked out they charged us for 2 extra days that we already paid to Hotels.com and threatened to charge us untill we came to check out unless we signed. When we got home we told hotels.com and they told us to take it up with the hotel and they refused to refund us so we had to dispute the charges with our credit card company.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value!”
Reviews.Author: KathyL20036
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights during a business trip to San Juan. The room was comfortable and clean, and a great value for the price (just under $100). The location is unbeatable -- a block from the beach, with plenty of restaurants within short walking distance. The hotel is older and shows some wear, but it's nothing major. The staff was helpful and polite; check-in and check-out were smooth. I've stayed at a dozen different hotels in San Juan on my various business trips there, and this hotel is my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy”
Reviews.Author: Jdkreceipts
Reviews.Content: Loud and poor service. Run down. Lousy amenities. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: TheButterflyFarm
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed here for 3 nights on a shopping trip. The 8th floor room was comfortable, clean and quiet. Complimentary breakfast, only the basics but enough to get us started. Friendly helpful staff. Great location for the Mall. For the money definitely good value and would stay here again if on a budget. Avoid the Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the money”
Reviews.Author: SLCparrothead
Reviews.Content: We booked here through Hotwire. This is not the Ritz Carlton. But for the money this was a good value. We stayed here for 2 nights before a cruise. It was clean and comfortable. Yes the hotel is a little old and the carpeting shows some wear. The room was clean and quiet. The bed was comfortable. The location is perfect, It is one block from the beach and also close to some very good restaurants. I don't understand people who book a room based on price and then compare it with other hotels that cost twice as much. It is a good value for what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...”
Reviews.Author: mountainmama79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night post-cruise having got a good price on priceline. As others have stated, check-in personnel don't seem to know what they are doing and it took a while. Our room was adequate, but noisy from the casino and lounge three floors down. Luckily the airconditioning drowned out most of the noise! The room was clean and large, and the hotel is in an area that has many restaurants to choose from. I would not stay here again because of the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again if it's free!”
Reviews.Author: formella
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on Thanksgiving and it was terrible. The tiny front desk was slow and didn't know what they were doing. The room was small, the bed & pillows were uncomfortable, and my BIGGEST complaint about the room was the air conditioner. It was loud all night long. A TERRIBLE night of trying to sleep. We used points for the stay so it was free, but even THAT was spending too much!

Reviews.Title: “It's a DUMP”
Reviews.Author: karen_22us
Reviews.Content: Arrived here today and the place is a dump...those pictures you see on Radisson website for this specfic hotel is false - don't rely on it as it's much nicer in pictures. This place is OLD and MUSTY. Our spring box on our bed was moldy and had stains - it was so gross I wanted to fly back home. Place is so outdated and needs an update. Location was only a block away which was convenient but it's rocky and the waves are harsh - you will need to walk a few blocks down to where you can swim. There were restaurants around - across the street was a Burger King and a nearby hospital had a UNO's, Fuddruckers, Starbucks and a Walgreen's which was convenient. There were also small little shops as well but if you're looking for more authentic cuisin there are small litle places around. I wish I would have stayed at a better hotel so I could of enjoyed my trip a lot more but PR is okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rose P
Reviews.Content: I have stayed often at the Radisson, when I haven't had the money to splurge on a more luxurious hotel. I think they are an excellent deal. Clean, friendly, perfectly situated in Condado...and I was so pleasantly surprised to find that the business center use is FREE! The "luxury" hotels charge for this service! I absolutely recommend this hotel. If you want to splurge and want luxury and want to spend on the hotel, ok...try La Concha or the Ritz. BUT, if you want to enjoy your stay in Puerto Rico, have a clean, very nice room and excellent service - and have money to spare to enjoy the island - book the Radissson!

Reviews.Title: “I Will Never Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm P
Reviews.Content: We had reservation for two nights at the Radisson prior to a seven day cruise. We arrived at the hotel at 6:00 pm to find that we did not have a room because their system was down. There were eight other guess ahead of us waiting for there rooms. We had to wait in a very small and crowded lobby. We tried to be understanding because things happen but the staff was not very friendly at all. After a six hour flight and waiting over an hour we finally were able to get a room. To my surprise the hotel is not well kept. The carpet in the room and hall ways looks like it has never been clean, carpet was dirty and stained. The furniture in the room looked like it came from an second hand store, very poor condition. Needless to say we will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: blucab1
Reviews.Content: The Radisson was a very nice hotel, clean, and a friendly staff.....nice pool area within walking distance of the beach, restaurants, and shopping.....also just nice if you want to go for a walk and see what is in the area... I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience - good location”
Reviews.Author: KJC2010
Reviews.Content: Pre-cruise stay. We booked our 2 night stay via Priceline and got a great deal otherwise it would not have been worth the typical price. The hotel itself offers many amenities (although we did not use most of them) including a nice quiet pool on the rooftop. My main complaint would be the lack of services available in the pool area. There was no food or drink service available and when we asked someone they offered to send someone to take our order but no one ever showed up. There is an outdoor bar set up but it was never open during our stay. The location is good, walking distance to several restaurants, including Starbucks and other hotels are a few blocks away. Only a block from a quiet area of the beach - steep stairs to access. By taking a walk along the beach we discovered other hotels that we would choose on our next visit. PROS: Nice lobby, friendly staff, quiet pool, proximity to beach, decent size room CONS: service by the pool

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay. Included breakfast not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Will C
Reviews.Content: I spent a total of 4 nights at this location. I booked the room via hotels.com. When I got into the front desk, I was told to go to the PH level since my reservation was a corporate one. Even though I did not require this, it turns out to be a good deal. The room was big and comfortable, with a nice king size bed. Wireless internet access was included, which was convenient in my case since I am taking an online course. Only issue with this is that it was slow at times, to the point of booting me off, therefore signing in a couple of times each day. Breakfast was also included, but I was not enticed by it, as it was tacky. They can come up with something better, especially for what they charge per room. Also, it's time for the hotel to do a renovation, as it looks outdated.

Reviews.Title: “expected more”
Reviews.Author: jacqueline1947
Reviews.Content: room a good size with comfortable beds but a/c not working.-advised them but they did nothing. poor lobby and needs overall updating. Booked hotel on priceline which I assumed all taxes included but charged extra 11% at check out. Expected more from a Radisson which is 31/2 star hotel. Probably would not stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good selection in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: smvhou
Reviews.Content: Have visited San Juan 25+ years, & this hotel has always been there, but I had never stayed there before. Wondered if it had been kept updated, which concerned me about staying there, but I should not have worried & I would stay there again without hesitation. Management has kept it nicely updated, & I think it is as good of value as you will find in the Condado area. Rooms are big & spacious & nicely furnished & everything is spotlessly clean. It's an old building, so you get the "small" bathrooms, but they are nicely upgraded with marble, tile, mirrors. Every staff member we encountered was courteous & helpful. In the best area of Condado, within walking distance of many bars, outdoor-seating restaurants, coffee shops, fast-food chains, shopping etc. Easy bus or taxi ride to Old San Juan if you don't have a car. On-site parking, but not sure of the cost. Remember, San Juan has an aggressive parking-enforcement program, so you stand a very good chance of getting a ticket if the meter is expired ($35), or you are parked improperly --- even though it looks like everyone is doing it.

Reviews.Title: “COULD HAVE BEEN BETTER”
Reviews.Author: 2Mari
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at this hotel for one night so that we could be closer to the airport for our return flight to Florida. The price for the room was not cheap and although the check-in clerk was very polite and efficient, we had trouble finding someone to help us sign on the the free wifi that was advertised. Needless to say, we were unable to go online and no one at the hotel seemed to be able to help. The rooms were adequate and they even had sleep number beds, but I found the decor very lacking and the rooms were very impersonal. When we arrived to our room, we found that the housekeeper had not finished cleaning the room and we had to switch to another one. The carpets are not very clean and the toilets are VERY noisy. It just seemed drab all around, so it unlikely that I would book a room here again, especially for the cost we paid. We expected so much more and were really let down.

Reviews.Title: “Ambassador Level Worth the Extra Cost?”
Reviews.Author: Dushi-NY
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel for a one night pre-cruise stay. Our flight arrived at 10:30 am. We knew that the rooms would not be available until early afternoon but decided to check in anyway. The $27 taxi ride from the airport ($19 + $1.50 surcharge + 3 pieces of luggage + tip) took 10 minutes as it was a Saturday morning and traffic was light. Upon arrival, only one person was working at the front desk in the lobby. 7 people were ahead of us either checking in or checking out of the hotel. After 45 minutes, a second person appeared. Shortly thereafter, it was our turn. The agent informed us that we could have checked in upstairs given that we booked an Ambassador Level room, (use the elevator bank to the left of the casino entrance, floor 9 or penthouse/pool level). After lunch at Orozco's, a 10 minute walk away, we checked in at the Ambassador Level Desk at 1 pm. We noticed a long line in the lobby but the check-in process upstairs was seamless. Check out the next day was quick and efficient. Again, there was a long line at the lobby dessk. We had friends who stayed in a regular room on the second floor. They were not impressed. Our room on the 8th floor was recently renovated and comfortable. In short, in our opinion, paying $25 extra for the Ambassador Level was well worth it. The perk also included evening snacks and continental breakfast. Only wish that we had prior knowledge about the separate check in area in the first place so that we could have saved 45 minutes in line on the first day.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Rburnit
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thru priceline and got a decent rate on a 2 night pre-cruise stay. The hotel is a bit older and could use an update, but it is just a 3.5 hotel and that is what you should expect. The rooms were clean, no issues with check in or check out. Customer Service was very good and the 2 free drink coupons were a nice touch. The bar/lounge seems to a favorite with the locals and made for a nice hangout in the evenings. There are plenty of places to eat close by. Walgreens is just down the street if you need anything, Burger King is next door if you really need a fast food fix. The beach is just a block away but a bit further to get to sand. The roof pool was fabulous as is the view from the top of this hotel. I have stayed in Old San Juan before and this was first trip to this area of town. I would stay here again if I were to go to San Juan again.

Reviews.Title: “this place is an absolute let down”
Reviews.Author: cedi_p
Reviews.Content: stayed here after the cruise before flying out. this hotel looks and smells like to very neglected business. I get the feeling they just squeeze the last drop out that business. noisy air conditioning, smelly carpets and everything seems very much outdated and run down. hopefully they will renovate it soon.

Reviews.Title: “Old”
Reviews.Author: firstborn_2006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson Ambassador Oct 21-24, 2011. In our opinion the Radisson was a dump. The rooms and hallways all smell like smoke. The rooms are very small and we were upgraded to a suite #504. Nothing in the room said suite to me. The carpet is very dirty and the rooms are dingy. I would never stay there again although the staff was very friendly the rooms really need to be upgraded. The water in the room only got luke warm so we were basically taking cold showers we didn't get any hot water until the last day surprise. Good location that's about it it's located more on the quiet end of the street all the action is near the LaConcha hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our vacation in PR”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie147320
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located. clean. The air condition did not work properly. Room was very hot . You have to pay for parking a lot. That's not a reasonable fare.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: lola_pr82
Reviews.Content: I managed to stay for 5 days. The check-in was extremely easy and the clerk was very helpful. He managed to even accommodate me in a room that was far from the casino. It didn't take more than 10 minutes. The room and bathroom were extremely clean. The bed was king sized and it was brilliant and super comfortable. I didn't want to get out. Room service delivered my food in the 40 minutes they promised. I asked for extra towels and were delivered promptly too. All in all, it was a great stay and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Marianna A
Reviews.Content: We recently went to Puerto Rico for a couple of days and had a great time! The Radisson is a great location to walk around and has an excellent variety of shopping and restaurants nearby. People working there are friendly and helpful. If you are going to gamble, as we did, I would definitely choose another casino though. The one in the Resort has very few gaming tables and is basically a casino for slots, etc. Much better choices nearby for sure! Overall I can recomend the Radisson as it is clean and econimical and a great location. Only thing I can advise is to look at a couple of rooms before taking up your baggage. We got two rooms and they both went for the same rate, but they were totally different qualities. The kids got a room that was like a mini-suite, and our room was very basic (yes, we did have the kids switch with us!). We recommend visiting the rainforest and also the Spanish Fort- El Morro- of Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “What r all the bad reviews about”
Reviews.Author: Shakazi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Ambassador Plaza Hotel & Casino San Juan on one night before my cruise. I had read the reviews and was unsure on this stay but got a great price. The hotel was excellent, I recieved great service. My room was very clean and was just as the pictures depicted. The tv showed very bad. but I wasnt there to watch tv. I did stay in the Ambassador suite, so it may make a difference. I had the breakfast which was nice and consisted of bagels, cereals, muffins, danishes, oatmeal, grits, fruits, ect. all was nicely presented. also their were also Hors d'oeuvres that evening. It was sandwiches and many other things. I dont eat pork so I just wish they had turkey items. What I liked best was the coffee machine it was great it served 7 different coffees better than *bucks. The last great thing was the free drink coupons we recieved in check in which was separate from the regular guest checkin. one other thing I did not like was they auto charged my account $1 to donate to a kids bank or something. not a big deal but it should have been offered not auto charged. over all great time OHHH and the club in the casino was off the chain. Rickey helped us with checkin and offered us all kinds of great tips on saving money in the local shops he gave the best service we have had in years an I was surprised to learn he would be burying his brother the next day, it said a lot to his personality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to the Beach!”
Reviews.Author: ddcoop1984
Reviews.Content: Greetings, We stayed at this hotel in September of 2011. The hotel was very close to the beach and had many nice attributes. We felt safe and comfortable. The staff were friendly. Watch out for traffic, San Juan, PR is a very fast pace environment. The population of San Juan is close to 400,000 and PR is about 4,000,000. The hotel had great views. We took a bus from the hotel for .75 to Old San Juan. In Old San Juan, we visited San Cristobal Fortress and El Morro Fortress which are a must see. The official food is Creole Cuisine. ***Room Info*** Stylish, Comfortable Hotel Rooms in San Juan The Radisson Ambassador Plaza Hotel & Casino offers 146 stylish guest rooms and 87 spacious suites. Each of our rooms features a range of convenient amenities, including cable TV, coffee makers, complimentary wireless Internet access and work desks. Whether you are traveling for business or leisure, you will find everything you need for a relaxing stay in San Juan. Hotel rooms at the Radisson offer the following amenities: Balcony Cable TV High-speed, wireless Internet access - complimentary Coffee and tea maker Iron/ironing board Local and toll-free calls - complimentary Newspaper - complimentary Pay per view movies Room service (6:30 a.m.-11 p.m.) Safe Suites available Two telephones Work desk with lamp ***Suites*** The Radisson Ambassador Plaza features a lavish, all-suite tower with 87 two-room suites. The tower offers you the comfort and privacy of your own elegant suite, as well as the following amenities: Alarm clock/radio Balcony Hair dryer Living room and bedroom Microwave Refrigerator Safe Sleep NumberÂ® bed Sofa bed Three telephones, all with data ports Two color televisions Working and dining areas Business Class Our Business Class guest rooms offer access to upgraded amenities, services and benefits that help you work more efficiently. Sleep NumberÂ® Beds Our San Juan hotel suites feature the exclusive Sleep NumberÂ® bed, which allows you to adjust the firmness of the mattress to your exact level of comfort with the touch of a button. For added comfort, these rooms also feature quality linens, down pillows and premium down-filled comforters nestled in ultra-soft duvet covers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel not the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Jermina J
Reviews.Content: the room was clean and spacious, very helpfull staff (cleaners and receptionist) would go back there for sure. ordered room service from the hotel it came late and couldnt even eat it. horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Radisson”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_ILJim
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, not outstanding, not bad - very reasonably priced. A very good place to stay for business - I would probably not stay there for a beach vacation because it's a very long block to walk to the beach. I've stayed here 3 or 4 times in 2011 so far, always for business. The rooms are fine, fairly modern, and they keep them clean. The casino is small, usually with only a few tables open. Not much happening at the lobby bar when I stopped by for a drink on a weeknight. The best part of this hotel is the location for nightlife. It's near many good local restaurants & bars that are within walking distance. Stay here if you are looking for a good/inexpensive business hotel in Condado near lots of nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is VERY nice and the location IS WONDERFUL.”
Reviews.Author: mommabean
Reviews.Content: I was fearful after reading the reviews prior to our 2 night pre-cruise stay on August 12 - 14. Apparently a lot of people have never been away from their cocoon of a town in the 50 states. I've stayed at the Ritz and I've stayed in Old San Juan but this was my first and definitely not my last stay in Condado. The neighborhood is fabulous. Turn left as you leave the Radisson and you will be in a more local Puerto Rican area. Turn right and you will be in the area catering to tourists. Our room was immaculate, large and fresh. My bed was comfortable. We had a regular king room on the ambassador club level. The views up here were great. We could see the city, the mountains and the sea. No, it's not beach front but it's only 1 block to a public beach where you can bring your own towel to sit. Or you can turn right and walk 3 or 4 blocks just past the Marriott, turn right, and go a block to the beach and rent a lounge chair for $3. How can anyone judge a hotel on the clients who are staying there any given night? That's ridiculous. Our first night found a lively, variable aged group of American's and Puerto Ricans enjoying live music in the lounge. There was a lot of drinking, dancing and having a good time. The next night was much quieter but there was still live music. We walked through the casino even though we don't gamble. It was a lot larger and more sprawling than I expected with rooms flowing into other rooms. There was something for everyone. We were given early check in just past noon with no problem by Luis at the front desk who was very polite. He was professional and I enjoyed giving him a wave each time we passed by his desk. Yes, he smiled back. The rooftop pool was clean and perfect. We went in the water and enjoyed visiting with other guests who told us how much they liked their stay here, too. Luis gave us some great dining suggestions. We ate at one place twice because the food was great and also a really good value. You'll find 2 walgreens and 2 starbucks within easy walking distance - one in each direction. Yes, you will see a few homeless people. Very few. Very harmless. And WAY less than you will ever see in the greatest city in the USA - San Diego, CA. We gave one man a pie we bought from a charity and he was so polite he thanked us and immediately ate it. You will see homeless people in every city in the USA. But you won't see streets this clean in most of them. This is a country of character. Be open minded about your travels. Our breakfast in the ambassador's club was very nice and had everything we wanted. Some people even enjoyed waffles, out of the toaster, but still it's offered. The bar in the evening was an honor bar. You make your own and fill out your own ticket. It was well stocked. Our bathroom was small but very functional with great counterspace. The lighting in the bathroom and in the bedroom was better than any hotel I've been in. Ladies should like this. The coffee maker actually had it's own little counter space outside of the bathroom. Many hotels these days are putting it right in the bathroom which to me isn't the most sanitary of places to keep your coffee and cups. This hotel does it right. Every room has a balcony so even if you don't want to pay extra for a high floor with a better view, you can at least step out to see what's going on around you. We had a sweet and cheerful housekeeper who gave us extra caffeinated coffee for the asking since they normally only leave one single serving of each type in the room. We don't drink decaf. Our AC was good and cold. There are loads of electrical outlets in the room which made it easy to charge up all our electronics at once. The wifi worked perfectly on all our devices, (iphones, ipad and netbook) and faster than most hotels. We liked having a safe which still some hotels are lacking. They even gave us each a free bar drink and bottled water daily which may just be because we were on the club floor. You can rent a car from hertz right next door. If you aren't daring enough for authentic Puerto Rican food, you'll find Burger King, Subway and Fuddruckers all either right next door or within a couple of blocks. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. I've never stayed at a Radisson before but after this experience, I'd happily book another one. You really should disregard all of the unfounded complaints you've read previously. I'm really picky and a neat freak and the Radisson met my unusually high standards. We've been out of the states plenty and appreciate the cultures of others and Puerto Rico is definitely not an extreme or frightening culture. Again, this is a GREAT location.

Reviews.Title: “an OK hotel if you have a specific reason to stay there”
Reviews.Author: gte937k
Reviews.Content: Bottom line: The hotel isn't terrible, but only stay here if you have a specific reason to... location, price, you love the beach nearby, etc. This hotel is at the tail end of Condado (East side). I'll let you decide if the location is convenient or not... it depends what you want to do in Puerto Rico. The property is dated and in need of some refreshing. There is parking on-site for $12.84/night with unlimited in/out. It was sometimes tough to find a parking spot. The beach is a bit of a hike. There are few decent places to eat in the area. Pros: -- I paid $75 + tax per night through priceline -- No resort fee -- Parking (for fee) on site -- Free drink coupons on check-in -- Breakfast was reasonably priced Cons: -- Bed isn't comfortable -- Rooms are not insulated. You hear everything going on outside. -- Housekeeping is dodgy. They don't vacuum and often forget to replace coffee, cups, etc. -- Old property that needs refreshing. -- Restaurant quality was lacking

Reviews.Title: “What if....”
Reviews.Author: CrucianSweetness
Reviews.Content: I booked a one bedroom suite at the raddisson.When my family and I arrived on the date for our room which was paid for in full.They said due to hotel policy they could not accommodate us.I have five children under 12,and pregnant with my sixth and was refused service because hotel policy is no more than 4 person to a room.The manager was very rude,and had no manners. He was loud and aggressive.I thank God for Coral by the Sea.Our money was refunded from the Raddison with a waived cancellation fee.It was for the best because we had more money for shopping.I stood in the lobby for about three hours hoping for the best,or the manager will take into consideration the children.My two youngest is 5 ,and 2.We stayed at Coral by the Sea with two queen size beds and a folded bed was adder to the room.Hotel policy sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great hotel in downtown San Juan”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyONE
Reviews.Content: The good: Free drink tickets given at check-in, along with a little "free money" to gamble in their casino with. The rooftop pool is open all night and offers a nice view of downtown San Juan. Great restaurant recommendation from the front desk (Do not miss out on the pizza or coconut flan from Danny's International just down the street. So delicious!). Staff is generally very helpful and polite. The bad: It's not well taken care of in areas - the room number had been ripped from our door and the numbers written on the door with magic marker, for example. Also, we stayed two separate nights, one at the beginning and one at the end of our trip, and our rooms lacked towels at both check-ins. The very bad: The hotel restaurant. The first night we arrived late, in pouring rain and opted to eat there for convenience's sake. The food was terrible. Of our three different meals, none were edible. The waitress didn't appear at all surprised to take three full plates back at the end of the "meal" and never asked how everything was (she probably knew...).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: donato1899
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. We paid $75.00 via Priceline. We paid $30.00 to upgrade to Ambassador club level at check in. We got our nice 8th floor room at noon. Club level gets a decent fruit/yogurt/pastry/cereal type breakfast. In the evening you get appitizers and an honor bar. There is an excellent coffee machine availabe 24 hours. I liked the neighborhood alot. There are manu good places to eat real Puerto Rican food. There are two walgreens, burgerking, subawy, two starbucks, everyting you could want. The neighborhood is a mix of apartments and hotels, hence there are plenty of friendly locals and tourists around. The beach is two blocks from the front door of the hotel. There are a very few homeless and one or two beggars. The street scene is cleaner than Miami, New Orleans or many other mainland cities. I prefer Condado to old San Juan or Isla Verde. The staff are a littlt cold, but that is their problem. They were helpful in everything we asked. Don't be put off by the bad reviews

Reviews.Title: “Way past its glory days”
Reviews.Author: TexKS
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked our stay for the night before we left on a week long cruise. We stayed on the club level, but I was not impressed with the room, the floor, or anything else. Staying on the club level required us to take an elevator from the lobby to check in at the club level. Then we had to go down a floor to get to our room. The "suite" was 2 very small rooms that would have made 1 nice room if the wall divider had not been there. The AC control didn't work very well and the sleep number bed hardly worked at all. Our balcony looked out over several residential towers that appeared deserted. We could see the ocean, but it was several blocks away and the staff warned us not to go there at night. We ate dinner at the hotel cafe. The food was average, but the kitchen was very slow. Our waiter brought us free soup to hold us until our meal arrived. We ate lunch at a local cafe the next day and had great food and service. Afterwards, we tried to use the fitness center (having been on airplanes all day), but they were all occupied. The free breakfast on Sunday was back on the upper floor so we had to take the stairs back up, only to find very little left to pick from. We weren't there for the first hour of the breakfast, but I thought someone should replenish the stocks as more guests arrived. Not at the buffet. The last 30 minutes was very limited in selection. This may have been a great place, but not any more. The staff was friendly, but they are working in a bad situation. I would not want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed :(”
Reviews.Author: HopeeR
Reviews.Content: We arrived around midday into San Juan from all night travel from Los Angeles. Needless to say we were exhausted from our lack of sleep on the plane. We arrived at the hotel and asked if it would be possible to have an earlier check-in, or at least a temporary room to lay down in until our room was ready. The staff was less than helpful. They were very uncaring, and in our opinions, lazy. We asked if the hotel was full, and they told us it wasn't so truthfully there shouldn't have been any issues. They had us sitting in the lobby for about an hour waiting and acted as if we were invisible. I would also say that this hotel would not be my recommendation for any visit to San Juan's Condado Beach. There was no access to the beach and the facilities were not impressive at all. Even the roof top pool was unheated and not very enjoyable to get into. Find another hotel on the beach with a nicer, more accommodating staff!

Reviews.Title: “worst customer service ever”
Reviews.Author: milaries
Reviews.Content: four months prior to my trip i made a reservation for an overnight stay before our cruise, check-in time is @ 3:00 pm we got there @8:45 pm , i call at 6pm to make sure my room was ready, i was told "yes is ready" just to get there and be inform, that it would be at least an hour before my room is available, so i ask the manager "would i be able to check out later than 11:00 am which is the check out time" the manager says no you need to be out by 11:00am, mind you is pass 9pm and my room is not ready, so after 30mins of agrevation on the phone with hotels.com my credit card was finally credit, since the manager refuse to credit me directly, there was a never an apology from the hotel staff(manager)so after all i had to take my family ,luggage and go look for hotel in the crowded condado area(san juan, pr) not only is hotel outdated, but the customer service is not professional at all, so sad because i expected much better expecially been puerto rican myself, and speak the language, since this guys english wasnt good at all, i wonder what happen if you can speak the language? and if you dont know the area?this is unexcusable after a long day of traveling and be meet with such a dilema, i'll never make a reservation with radisson again, we ended up at the holiday inn express ,much cheaper great service, free breakfast, and clean safe area....

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as what we expected”
Reviews.Author: littysmom2
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and accommodating. My mother and her friend shared a room. My daughter and I were able to upgrade to a suite for an extra 60.00. I didn't think that was something we could do since placed a bid on Priceline. We all had a nice stay with no complaints. I would stay there again, but I am not fussy. It was clean, and that means alot!

Reviews.Title: “6/11 - Perfect for an Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: RoseAlee
Reviews.Content: We have used the Radisson on two other trips overnighting for flight connections, as was the case this time on our way to Martinique. Little has changed since 2009. The hotel is clean, service is acceptable but not real friendly, and convenient to a few restaurants we like. The beds are comfortable. Taxi fare from the airport is $15 + gas surcharge + baggage or around $20. The internet was weak and we had to have the door open to the hallway to receive any signal. We don't gamble so can't comment on the casino, but it looked fairly small. All-in-all, we will continue to use the Radisson for our overnight stays, but would stay elsewhere when we come back for longer stays on the island. Larry & Kelly, Georgetown, TX

Reviews.Title: “What a dump! Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: AtticusB
Reviews.Content: First the staff here is rude and highly unmotivated. The check in is at THREE O' CLOCK and not one minute before. Assuming that this is for cleaning would be wrong. We stayed here two days; one before and one after a cruise. Unfortunately, we prepaid with no refund, or we would not have stayed the second night. The first night we were exhausted after 12 hours of travel and because of meeting with friends we didn't screw around with the staff. We just kept our shoes on in the room. The carpeting in the room was so wet you would think they were vacuuming with a mop and bucket. They have coffee machines in the room but they are designed for two individual cups of coffee. They only leave one regular and one decaf coffee packet (you need one per cup) and no creamers (dry or otherwise). On our second night at THREE O'CLOCK and not one minute before we were given our room; this time a suite. The sheets were badly stained and ripped. The coffee cups were not clean. One had lipstick and the other had semi dry coffee in the bottom. We went down to the front desk and stood in line (despite no one else being there) until the staff chose to acknowledge us. This is a very common thing at this hotel. All of the staff seems to have something better to do or talk about then customer service. We showed the desk manager the cups and complained about the sheets. He called over the housekeeping manager and she wrote down our complaint and took the cups. We went out and after dinner returned to our room. They returned the two cups to the room. Only the lipstick had been wiped off-the cups were still dirty (quite sure they were the same cups). The sheets had not been touched and were still disgusting and so now it was back down stairs to wait in a line of one. We were told the only thing they can now do is move us to another floor. So we packed up and moved two floors up. The carpet in this room was also wet in places. The sheets were still torn but less stained (definitely not hotel quality and according to the note markered on them they were new in 2008 when Radisson took over). Over the years I have stayed in some low end motels for business and this place ranked with them at twice the price. They claim free Wi-Fi but it is spotty at best (good reception in the restaurant or front desk). The restaurant staff was actually good although the breakfast buffet needs work. The hotel appears to need major repairs, the satellite cable connections to room are in need of an overhaul and it is two blocks from a second rate beach. The outside noise is constant (think staying in New York). They had a band in the bar that was playing at volume that would rival a Who concert (not great for a bar only 10 feet wide). Overall we were ripped off. Have a good vacation - stay somewhere else. Consider the Marriott down the street (new building, on a first class beach), wish we had.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: LStravel71
Reviews.Content: Had a trip to PR. Hotel was great for the AAA price. Older hotel but still nice. We had access to the Ambassador club on the 8th floor, where they offered free continental breakfast. Enjoyed the free drinks that were offered. The pool is rooftop which was very nice. The beach was 2 blocks away, nothing to brag home about. The beds were comfortable, room had slight order but if you keep the air on, it would drown it out. When going into town, easy access to the bus line, only 75 cents, take the 51/53 into Old San Juan. Staff was friendly. Would stay again for short trip no more than 3 days. Free internet but when I tried skype it wasn't that great quality. Do the Barcardi Rum trip without the tour it is free, take a ferry it is only 50 cents each way and $3 for cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best neighbord; Lots of homeless people; not for first time visitors; not actually near beach”
Reviews.Author: al0hakim
Reviews.Content: I had been to Puerto Rico about seven years ago with my family and decided to return again for a celebration for my college graduation. I had enthusiastically described to my boyfriend how much fun the trip would be, having had such a pleasant hotel experience at an Isla Verde location in the past. However, when we checked into the Radisson in Condado Beach we were shocked to see the condition of the neighborhood and the hotel itself. The taxi ride from the airport to the hotel was brief, but did not look like any place where a hotel should be. We stepped into the lobby, which was narrow and dim, to learn that our room did not include a refrigerator. The next morning at breakfast we paid $15 a plate at the "breakfast buffet" for less than stellar scrambled eggs and yogurt. This led to daily trips to the nearby Walgreen's where we purchased food that did not need to be microwaved or refrigerated, because neither contraptions were available to us during our stay. Each trip led to us being bothered and followed by at least two homeless people in a short distance of only two blocks. The description on the Radisson's website claims that the hotel is only a block away from the beach. It fails to mention that this beach is also plagued with homeless people, covered halfway with rocky shoreline, and is not large enough to even sunbathe. If you are not fluent in Spanish you will feel lost in this neighborhood and will be unable to do so much as order a meal at the next door Burger King. Needless to say, I felt embarrassed and won't be returning to Puerto Rico again because of this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: WestCoast_Peach
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and saw the hotel photos for myself online, so I didn't go into this expecting 5 star amenities. I was disappointed that the hotel rooms were different than what was portrayed on their website. The beds were small, and our view was of the Burger King garbage can and roof. The ambassador club level amenities were nice but meager compared to other places I've stayed. Can't even imagine what the "regular" amenities looked like. The on site casino left A LOT to be desired, but I left Puerto Rico feeling this way about the place overall. I'll make this short. Pay more $ and stay elsewhere. The only "good" thing about this place was its proximity to La Placita (walking distance, but don't dare go alone), and local eateries. Other than that, blah. If I never returned to San Juan it would be too soon.

Reviews.Title: “If you are under 60 I wouldn't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaMHall
Reviews.Content: The room was wonderful and they upgraded us to a suite for free. But the lobby was full of geriatrics drinking and gambling and it smelled like nasty perfume the whole time. A good place to stay if you're not going to be at the hotel alot. Also, a very iffy part of town

Reviews.Title: “Not improving over the years”
Reviews.Author: Martinzz
Reviews.Content: Been staying there repeatedly since 2007; and hadnÂ´t I had en elite status with Radisson, IÂ´d be already looking elsewhere. My two last visits have both been spoiled by problems - one by night-time street noise, the other by a major front desk mess-up. There is no improvement nor refurbishment over the years, the reception area is very poor with noise both from the casino and the bar, very little place to sit and the worst thing that can happen is a street party out on Ashford Avenue with loud music until well past midnight. Needless to say the windows are nowhere near to soundproof. A few positive aspects would be the location in the vicinity of a variety of restaurants, walking distance to the beach and quite an easy access to/from the airport. IÂ´ll give this hotel one last chance, but IÂ´m sure there are better places nearby.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL SURPRISE”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanSupers
