Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed at the hotel before our cruise and we were suprised that is was so comfortable, the free breakfast was nothing to write home about but we made out. the rooms are very spacious and clean which was very important to me since i was traveling with a small child, the pool area was always very well kept, and the staff was very friendly, we plan to return for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room at a Low Price”
Reviews.Author: mvg1269
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I really got a great night's sleep at this hotel. Even though it's in a not-so-great part of SJ, once you're in your room you feel so relaxed and at ease that you won't hear the traffic or the other guests in their rooms. The hotel itself looks like a mash of different, eclectic decorative styles-one of which, I think, was art deco. Every time I walked out of the room and into the hallway I felt very much like I had walked onto the set of Kubrick's "The Shining". Still, I would definitely stay here again in the near future. The bedding was superb, complete with two huge flat screen tvs and a sleep comfort bed that provided me with the best sleep I'd had in at least a month prior to my trip to PR. After a drama-filled week (I was there for my father's funeral) this was a pleasant and unexpected surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Good value location for pre-cruise trip”
Reviews.Author: sharksfansd
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to stay for two nights prior to our cruise. The main reason we booked the hotel was for the price and it did not disappoint for the value. I would not recommended this hotel though if you are planning an extended vacation in San Juan. If I was staying in San Juan would prefer a hotel that is actually on the beach and one that is a higher rating (i.e. Marriott or Sheraton). Also, if you request a balcony definitely try and get a higher floor. Our balcony view was the burger king drive thru (3rd floor). A plus for the roof top pool though.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: gilead
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure where I wanted to stay in San Juan, even though I have been there. Condado seems like a good middle location, not far from the airport, not far from Old San Juan. I was looking for the cheapest price at a Brand Name hotel with a pool. I got everything I wanted at the Radisson. They had a short special online for their club room (includes continental bfst, a welcome drink, afternoon hors d'oeuvres, and a coupon for the casino.) The afternoon snacks were nothing more than a ham and cheese hero cut into pieces, and some veggies and dip. The breakfast was more substantial. No eggs, but all sorts of cereals, fruit and bread/pastries, eggo waffles, etc. A decent coffee maker machine too. What I liked most was the roof top pool. When it's a nice day, it's the perfect place to relax. The casino is fine if you like slots. Quite a crowd on a weekend night. We stayed two times. The first time in a regular king room, which was very spacious. The 2nd time we were put into a suite (room 809) with a balcony and best view possible given the surrounding buildings do block a lot of the beach view. It was extremely nice, knowing the price I paid. Certain staff were very friendly like Milagros on the club level. Restaurants are walking distance, including Starbucks and Walgreens. The beach closest to the hotel is sort of gross, and feels like a neighborhood beach as opposed to a resort location, but we preferred the pool anyway. If you want a nice beach, leave San Juan and go to Liquillo Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service...!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wislie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and me decided to make a same day reservation at this hotel, we got a good rate online. Once we arrived we were not welcomed with a smile, they never ask us for a Id so I wonder how did they knew it was our reservation. After we checked in, the lady didn't even tell us how to get to our room, or where was anything located. Well I asumed it could have been bcause of the time we arrived, but at check out we also had a poor service. I could understand that they didn't have system to print our bill but if you inform us that you would send it by email I asume you will not forget. They didn't ask us how was our stay or even invite us to stay again. Three days after check out I had to call to ask about the email of our bill, a very friendly gentelman named Hiram at accounting help me out and was very very helpfull, I highly recommend that this hotel should have staff like him at front desk. It's a very nice hotel, but they have to get better regarding service.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable but tired”
Reviews.Author: pasierra1
Reviews.Content: First the high points: All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The front desk folks tried hard but were not in any hurry. The bathroom in my room had been remodeled at some point and was nice.Although I never made it to the beach, it was only a couple of blocks away. The location is good with a large number of decent restaurants and fast food within easy walking distance. I felt quite safe wherever i walked at night. I did not go to the beach at night but was warned not to. Downside: The lobby and the room (other than the bath) felt like Las Vegas in the 70s. Gold highlights, glitzy fixtures, and just plain old. The lobby is narrow and congested at times. It took four trips back and forth to my room before I had a card key that worked on the door. The hot breakfast in the Ambassador Bar cost $11.50 and was only available on Monday morning. The food served at breakfast and dinner was average-neither good nor bad. If you are on the Burger King side you can look forward to the trash pickup at 5:30 AM on Monday morning. Summary: It's ok but old and tired. If you are looking for a really nice place, this isn't it. I like most of the people I meet in Puerto Rico but their drum beat may be rather slower than what you are used to on the mainland. Things that bother us here don't seem to bother anyone there. Good and bad, I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “We should have spent more on a nicer hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Bum_tlc
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'd like to say that the service at this hotel was very friendly and accommodating. However, the staff doesn't have much to work with in terms of a property. I really wish we had paid a little more for a better location and a nicer hotel. When we arrived at the hotel there were 2 people in the check-in line ahead of us. When we finally got to the desk about 25 minutes later, we were informed that housekeeping did not yet have our room ready. It was 10:30 p.m! The man behind the desk said that he could give us a different room but that it would be directly over the casino and we would hear the casino all night. (I was grateful that he warned us of this fact.) So, we decided that we would wait in the bar for 30 minutes as our room was readied. We were immediately given a voucher for 2 free drinks at the bar, which I thought was quite nice. When we arrived at the room, it was just strange. It was supposed to have been a "Microwave Executive One Bedroom Suite." There was a division between the "living" area and the sleeping area, but there was no microwave and, as far as I could tell, no place for one. There were two closets, one in each area, but there were no hangers in the closet in the living area and only 8 hangers in the other. Definitely not enough hangers for 2 people to unpack. The "living" area had a desk and chair, and then one side chair. There was a TV in this room, but it wasn't really a comfortable place for TV viewing. All in all, the space was just strange and dark. The furnishings had also seen better days. But, the worst part was the smell. The entire hotel was supposedly non-smoking, but the room smelled like it had been smoked in....a lot. It was also kind of damp and musty smelling, so much so that I really wanted to go out and buy some air freshener or something. But I didn't. I just dealt with it. The bathroom was pretty beaten up as well. The flooring tile was cracked and the toilet was leaking on the floor. The location was really strange as well. It is a block or two from the beach, but it doesn't feel like it. Our room was on the second floor, so the street noise was annoying when we were trying to sleep. We checked in on a Thursday night, which wasn't too loud, but Friday and Saturday nights were a different story. All night long there was shouting, singing, clapping, etc. in the street outside the room. We investigated and found that there was a Burger King with a drive-through directly across the street from our room. We had not been aware of this since our balcony was angled away from the BK and toward the ocean (though we couldn't see it either for all the run-down buildings between it and the hotel). All in all, I'd say we made a mistake staying here. Next time we will stay at a nicer property and probably will not stay in the Condado area. The Isla Verde area is not far away and was a nicer and more happening area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: martyap
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a few days....great location.....we were upgraded to an 8th floor ambassador club room....clean and comfortable......free continental breakfast.....free appetizers from 5:30 to 7:30 pm........lovely staff....great price for the area.....walgreen's and restaurants at your doorstep......would certainly recommend without reservations!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: redstar255
Reviews.Content: Our first room had mold, paint on the outlets, the Cable TV outlet cover was cracked and hanging, one tv didn't work, safe out of order, brown smears on the sheets, bathroom only good for inducing a good vomit. 2nd room- dirty curtains, wet rug with mold (ruined our socks), mold under sink, furniture stunk. 3rd room....gave up!!! Slept in filth! Washed ourselves in kerosene and left the next morning! DO NOT STAY HERE! What a dump!!!!

Reviews.Title: “no complaints”
Reviews.Author: jayceetraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel met our needs for our two-night stay prior to embarking on a cruise. We signed up for Ambassador Club, mostly for the morning breakfast, which was sufficient with juice, danishes, coffee, and fruit. We did not attend the afternoon cocktail offering. The room was very spacious (again, Ambassador Club suite of king bed, adjacent room with desk, TV, beverage sink and fridge). The roof-top pool was nice. The hotel is one block from the beach, but that part of Condado is not conducive to swimming. Walk west toward El Morro for better beach options. Danny's International, 3 blocks west of hotel, had good food. Other restaurants in that area were very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews seem to be spot on”
Reviews.Author: zheather
Reviews.Content: This hotel had pros and cons. At the normal (non-promo) price at $200+ it is definitely not worth it. We used airline miles to pay for the hotel so the cost was not so much of an issue. Overall, despite its issues, we had a good time and I would recommend it with the note not to hold your breath expecting a resort-like experience. Rooms: We requested a room on a high floor to avoid the noise noted by others and ended up on the 8th floor. One night we could hear someone snoring in another room - but other than that - no noise issues. We had a partial view of the ocean blocked somewhat by other buildings. The room was smaller than I expected, but it was clean and did not smell funny. We noticed the A/C was broken - but after a long trip we decided to wait until morning to bring it to the attention of the front desk. The next day we left early and did not return until the afternoon. When we came back the A/C was fixed, but it was not properly linked to the wall unit, so we had to manually turn it on and off at the base. Not a huge issue for us. The shower at times in the morning goes in and out of water pressure/heat, but not to the extent I had to jump out of the shower. We got multiple HBO stations and a wide variety of channels - with a large flat screen (but low resolution) TV. Location: The hotel is located in Condado on Ashford Avenue - close to Walgreens, Burger King and Subway among other American chains. It is also a short walk from a range of quality and eclectic restaurants. It is however, a long walk (we did it twice) to Old San Juan. It does not have its own beach - but there are plenty nearby - such as the Marriott (where our friends stayed) in which you can get your fruity drinks and lounge chairs. I've read some really great reviews of the Marriott (which is more expensive) and I wasn't really that impressed by it in person - they also did a poor job of handling my friend's wedding making several critical errors in planning and reservations. Hotel & Staff: The staff were very friendly and helpful. On the top floor - the hotel offers a fitness room - however half of the machines were not in operation. There are two treadmills, an eliptical, stairmaster, bikes and some basic weights. There are two TV's. There is a rooftop pool, but we spent most of our time outside the hotel. We didn't go into the casino, hotel bars or restaurant so I can't really comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “second time around”
Reviews.Author: sushi14
Reviews.Content: this was my second stay at the radisson. only difference is that i booked an ambassador room this time. have to admit it was very nice. private check-in,a very nice lounge with an impressive continental breakfast. the staff was very friendly and the hotel was clean. nice location and everthing was in walking distance. beach is only a block away. i used my AAA membership and really got a great deal on the room. i plan to return in the fall!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: stanberys2
Reviews.Content: Spent the night before a cruise. We arrived late and the Casino with all the music and noise were in Full swing. We asked for a quiet room and were pleasantly told there wasn't one available for the price we paid. The clerk then upgraded us from a regular hotel room to a 2 room suite. Everything was very clean, quiet and lovely and all the rooms are non smoking. Purchased on Price Line for $99 night, with tax AND insurance, was total $124. Will absolutely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “ok-good location to see the city”
Reviews.Author: slkiowa
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night pre-cruise, room was clean, got two queen beds for $159 per night, not bad for a hotel in the area. Was in close walking distance to restaurants and the beach. Room had view of burger king-not too appealing! Not bad over all, live entertainment was ok, and enjoyed watching the game in the lounge, Check in and check out were ok!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: CRMedina
Reviews.Content: We had booked our stay via Travel Points to arrived on a Sunday, early afternoon. Although they could not find the Travel Points reservation, they assured us that the reservation could be confirmed on Monday morning and that we would be reimbursed for the Sunday stay as part of the initial reservation. They went out of there way to assist us and we were given a spectacular room. There is a small casino in the lobby area (mostly local seniors), two great restaurants, a great pool on the roof and the beach is at the end of the block - we only peeked it - we had plans to other locations and mainly enjoyed the evening portion of the hotel! We heard rooms are better a few floors above the Casino if you don't want noise. We were on the 8th floor and had no problems. I believe valet parking was about $4 or so, a day. There is parking close in the vicinity, just like a City, you've got to drive around the block(s) and get lucky (parking regulations apply)! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the suite.”
Reviews.Author: caperata
Reviews.Content: Adult son traveling with parents, so the suite was nice. Short walk to the beach. Nice pool on the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay in PR”
Reviews.Author: Araian85
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the check-in was fast. The room and bathroom were clean. We stayed in the Ambassador floor on room 635. The curtains had blackouts and there was a nice little balcony, though it needed a little more cleaning. The bathroom was fine, except for the bathtub that had a crack on the wall. Shower pressure and hot water were perfect. Housecleaning is done everyday. There was a mini-fridge in the room, capable of holding ice cream and to make ice. Complementary coffee to make on the coffee maker everyday. There weren't many channels to tune to on the TV, but they do have their share of movies. The breakfasts and hors d'oeuvres at 5pm were great they had a great selection and were very tasty, we had our fill. Pool was nice, clean and in a well secluded area. They have computers and printers available too. The Ambassador Grill's food and service was good. They had good choices in the menu and all was well cooked and finely presented. The drinks were generous. This hotel is a good stay if visiting San Juan for sightseeing and chopping. There are taxis always available. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ColR06
Reviews.Content: We spent a great week at the Radisson. The service was really excellent, the friendliness of the staff and their cooperation to make our stay as best as possible was really increadible, specially as the weather did not cooperate with our plans. When we had a problem with our air conditioner (at 11:00PM) it was repaired with in five minutes of calling. Any request was filled inmediately and with a big smile. I felt more than a guest my stay felt as if we were staying with family.

Reviews.Title: “good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: smartquest
Reviews.Content: if you stay in this hotel book the club rooms, they include a nice breakfast and a nice snack at 5 pm, the rooms are OK and clean, the parking is sometime a pain as they rent the hotel for parties, and the parking is not free

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: antiquelover20
Reviews.Content: stayed over 2 days in PR for our cruise- this hotel had everything the other didn't- this had coffee in the rooms and a casino and was really a nice change of pace from the other (Miramar) so if given a choice= choose this one- well worth the money and less than the other one we stayed at. We enjoyed our stay and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “It's a great place, but...”
Reviews.Author: PeterGrant76
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of TA reviews for two nights pre-cruise and one after. Once we booked, the price kept going down through e-mail offers, from $152 to $101 for the first two nights and to $126 for the third. They add 22% in tax and fees, though. Check-in at midnight was smooth, though the noise from the casino makes conversation difficult in the lobby. Got an upgrade which included free continental breakfast. Seventh-floor suite overlooked the parking lot, a source of entertainment as gamblers stumbled to their cars. Breakfast was fine, but there was no regular coffee available, only specialty brews (latte, espresso) from a machine. Odd. Location in Condado is great, with bus stop and restaurants nearby. Staff are outstanding â€“ cheerful, helpful and polite. Two negatives: room thermostat kept resetting to 68 (too cold) and the bathroom had no fan or air inlet. On our second stay, didn't qualify for free breakfast, had to keep checking whether our room was ready (which it was, by 1:30), room safe (at floor level) didn't work, thermostat default at 67, no phone book in the room, had to get permission from the front desk to call our airline. Just a one night stay so (except for the safe) we didn't bother to complain, until now. Overall, this is a very good hotel. Despite the problems, we'd happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlondieNYC
Reviews.Content: If you are on a budget and not staying that long it is ok. rooms need to be updated. small pool on roof. You have to walk a couple of blocks to the beach waves were crazy. Puerto Rico is over rated it is like being in miami way to commerical. There are no all inclusive resorts so food and drinks become expensive everyday. Puerto Rico hotels should take a lesson from other carribean Islands.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2sweet4u
Reviews.Content: I just came back off my birthday trip to San Juan and we stayed here before and after my cruise. The hotel itself was nice and clean. At first they put me in a room were the balcony was only a brick wall and i am only 5'1" and i couldn't even see over the wall. After one call they quickly upgraded us to a suite and i had an awesome view of the ocean to my left. The bed was really comfortable. The first night in the suite we had the sleep number bed that is over rated.... i never found my number....LOL. The hotel is downtown and close to everything, There is a hertz rental car office right next door and a burger king on the other corner. The beach is one block away. valet parking is $15. Overall i enjoyed my stay and i think it was a great for the price. I didn't win any money in the casino.....but i did drive down the street to the marriott and won back what i lost.... so all is well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...and I know hotels!”
Reviews.Author: shorelineinnom
Reviews.Content: I am a manager of a hotel and I am usually very picky. I was kinda worried when we booked this hotel, but we needed it before our cruise took off so I thought, "lets just make the best of it!". Well, I didn't have to do anything to make it a great stay! This hotel is not very close to the port, BUT they have great service, rooms, entertainment and the city life around the hotel is great as well. It is not located in a bad part of town and there is shoppinga nd dining just within walking distance. The hotel has a great restaurant in it as well and casino that is pretty nice too. All in all, I will stay again next year and only at this hotel in teh future!

Reviews.Title: “Not known for the view!”
Reviews.Author: HideawayCouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and found that the gal at the front desk was worth mentioning...she was great! We were upgraded to a very nice room which we found very clean and plush...but you don't want to look out the window. Kind of noisy in the streets for sleeping....the location was about a block from the water...but not a beach for swiming...just nice to look at with the rocks and waves. We walked about 5 miles to Old San Juan one day and 5 miles back...very nice walk but better off taking a taxi for $20. The good part is there are lots of places to eat within blocks. Wish it was located in a better place for either the beaches or places to see. If you plan on renting a car...plan on $13 per day to park at the hotel...even though you're staying there. Oh...did we mention $12 to watch a movie on tv? The pool was out of service!

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Chryss2cute
Reviews.Content: I escaped from St. Croix to Puerto Rico for a weekend. My only issue was the fact that there was a culinary festival RIGHT in front of the hotel. I rented a car with GPS & had to find alternate ways to get to the hotel. I had to circle it about 3 times before I got in. Parking was $12.44 per day. My only issue with that was that there was no way for a guest to know how they were suppose 2 differenciate themselves from outsiders. I was charged twice in one day until I spoke with someone at the front desk & was told what to do. My last day the person at the parking garage tried to charge me for all the days & didn't wanna deduct the my previous charges from the balance, I had to go to the lobby and have them take care of the situation. I ended up not having to pay but I spent like 20 extra minutes, which caused me 2 arrive late to the airport; almost missed my flight. Because of the festival, at night it was quite noisy. I was on the 8th floor in the executive suites & I could still here them. Another issue was that there was a hair in my towel and strands of hair in the tub. My TV didn't have the pay per view option (why? idk). I was given a card for a complimentary drink upstairs in the Grill Lounge & it was DELICIOUS! The continental breakfast was great, however, the complimentary h'orderves could have been MUCH better. The hotel is close to everything! Very convenient. I stayed there last year & when I return later this month I will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: brunswick
Reviews.Content: Good location. Near restaurants and transportation. Safe area - in the evening people are jogging, families strolliing, and several open air restaurants. 24-hour mini-market and two Walgreens nearby. This is a no frills hotel. You most likely will not see anyone around to help with your bags. Front desk staff were very pleasant. Lobby is small and certainly not the Marriott or Hilton. The bedding and bath were quite clean. Carpets could use a good shampoo, especially in the corners. If you get a good rate like on Priceline, this is a good value. Six cruise ships can be in town at one time. Only one ship was at dock on our arrival, which made our check in easy and early check in possible. Taxis are regulated at $18 to almost any point. B21 bus runs in front of the hotel (75 cents exact change) and goes into town.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here for the beach...”
Reviews.Author: dealeya
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 days expecting to take advantage of it's professed closeness to the beach and the sites of San Juan. I was disappointed to find that in fact, hotel is not near the sights and the beach that the hotel claims is near by, leaves much to be desired. In fact, the beach was on the back side of the hotel surrounded by cement barriers to keep cars from running off the road into it. Not cool a all. A lot of older locals like to frequent the hotel b/c of the casino. So there was always a lot going on. Unfortunately, this meant that the parking lot was packed. On several days, I spent 30 minutes driving the small parking lot waiting for someone to leave so that I could park and it's not like the parking was free b/c i stayed at the hotel. If you're going to stay at this hotel, be sure to rent a car or be prepared to pay a lot in taxi fees to get around b/c there is not much to see in the area. The hotel suit itself was pretty comfy. If you wanna go to PR to spend a lot of time in your hotel room, or a the casino, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: RickFSt_LouisMO_USA
Reviews.Content: Found a $93 rate on cheapostay.com for a king room. Upon arrival was upgraded to a suite. Very friendly employees from the front desk to the housekeepers. Nice location with plenty of eating places around. Hotel was very clean and the room was cleaned immaculately everyday. Rooftop pool was a nice plus along with a nice business center. Free wi-fi throughout

Reviews.Title: “I just keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: Catguy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in quite a few hotels in San Juan, Puerto Rico, but I keep coming to the Radisson freaquently. I manage to find great rates through internet and I always get a wonderful room and a very warm welcome in reception. I've never had a problem checking in and I almost always get the floor I want and also the view. This time I got the 48 hour promo-Ambassador Club Room for a great rate which included access to the club room on the penthouse, business center with free internet use, breakfast and other things. The room was just beautiful, so I can imagine the suites are awesome. Being a member of their Golpoints Program just makes it better. I do think the parking is very expensive but at least the car is safe. It should be free for the guests staying in the hotel. Still, I'll keep coming here again and again for my quick weekend escapes...

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: rriospr7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during our second phase of our visit to Puerto Rico. We had spend 4 previous nights in another part of the island and wanted to stay near San Juan for two days prior to our departure. I booked via hotels.com and was able to get a non smoking room (king bed) on the fifth floor for $93/night plus taxes (came out to $234 total for two nights). Pros: Convenient location -- 7 minute drive to Old San Juan, 15 minute drive to airport. Rooms were clean, nothing fancy, but fully functional. We had a small balcony (not really used) which faced the parking lot. From my observation the only rooms that would have a beach view would be the top floor rooms with views towards thebeach but even those I believe would only be a partial view of the beach which is 1 block away from the hotel. Easy walk to convenience store both locally ownned ones and national chains (Walgreens). One complimentary drink ticket per individual in your room (not bad since drinks run about $5.50/piece). On Friday night there was a very good spanish (latin salsa and merengue) band in the hotel cabaret area (near casino) which provided some great music until 4:00AM -- so you don't need to go anywhere to be entertained, but be warned the cabaret area with dance floor is small and crowded (we got there at 1100PM and stayed for about 1.5hrs. Cons: Ok, the area around Ashford Ave where the hotel is out are going through a transition phase so don't expect this to look like the French Riviera....it is not necessarily the "hood" as another reviewer wrote but you can see signs of graffity in many of the real estate properties (both old hotels and former commerical sites that are no longer in business). There will be the 1 homeless guy per block, but did not feel like they were a bother and did not hassle us as we walked both in the AM and evenings. Plenty of police presence patrolling the local area so I was not concerned for the safety of my wife and I as we strolled though the local blocks. The city of San Juan (or maybe this is part of Santurce (Condado) need to re-invest some money in to the upkeep of the infrastructure (bus stops, garbage cans, etc....) to make sure the place looks presentable to visitors...Hotel staff -- fron desk lady that checked me in was friendly but I can not say the samething about all employees we encountered...totally different than what I had just experienced at Dorado Embassy Suites, where everyone greeted you regardless of the time of day. There was no offer from bellhop to bring bags up to the room, which I could certainly have used. Hotel management should address this with their staff, a little reminder of customer service. Lobby area is tight as you check in with the casino being just a few feet away from it. Parking was ok at a self rate of $12.00. If I had to do it all over again, I would not get a rental car and simply take the bus or a taxi to go to Old San Juan ($15.00 each way), and to the airport (about same rate).

Reviews.Title: “Good location and Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: whawk
Reviews.Content: Only stayed (1) night on the 6th floor as part of the ambassador club room group. Very good continental breakfast and buisness center, It was two blocks to the beach with adequate convience store and eating places within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: paradise_island72
Reviews.Content: Reasonable and good stay during T-giving weekend. I might choose this hotel again if I have another chance to go to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay--Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Maddie665
Reviews.Content: Arrived tired sleepy around 4:30 am after flying all day. The front desk was very friendly and quickly checked me in. Very nice clean room. Close to the beach and places to eat. Great block party on our last night there. Music food drinks... Check out was fast...Over all a good experience. Would go back to this hotel good value....... : - )

Reviews.Title: “good pre and post cruise place to stay”
Reviews.Author: iLuvKona2
Reviews.Content: Actually quite nice for the price. Make sure you are not placed on the second floor above the casino-the noise is awful--we requested another room and they promptly changed it. They lived up to the Radisson commitment to make sure the guest was happy. Post cruise--as the other reviews have stated--the ship dumps you off mid morning and you cant get your room until mid afternoon, so that was a real hassle. You would cater to the ship traffic and set aside a block of rooms for the early arrivals. Some good restaurants within a block of the hotel. We enjoyed both the Italian and Mexican open air venues. Food blah at the hotel eatery, but happy hour at the bar was good stiff drinks! Wireless Internet not free, but was able to get an outside connection by the window in the room and also in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good qualities outweigh bad.”
Reviews.Author: DRoachBlackRock
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice experience. On the downside, lobby and casino a little cramped. Also although great location on Ashford Ave., one has to walk down a crummy side street to reach a sub-par area of the beach. View from the room located on side of hotel consisted of the dumpster of the back of the Burger King across the way. On the plus side a decent restaurant on sight, lots to do within walking distance and a friendly and helpful staff. Room was a nice, although smaller suite at an incredible rate booked from the bottom of the hotel's website. Decent pool area and gym on roof.

Reviews.Title: “Decent pre-cruise / after-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug8920
Reviews.Content: Stayed over one night in San Juan at the Radisson after we disembarked our cruise ship. When we arrived at the hotel the lobby was extremely busy with other customers (majority just coming back from a cruise as well) waiting to hold bags since we were there before check in time. We waited between 30-40 mins for the bell boys to get to our bags but they were extremely apologetic. To be honest they did the best they could in the situation and I can't complain too much since it was pouring outside. When coming back from shopping and walking around Old San Juan during the day (highly recommended) we checked in super quick and was given 2 complimentary drink vouchers for the casino. When we got to our floor immediately there was a strange odor and extremely odd look to the hallway and all the rooms. It was quite strange and made me feel like I was walking through a run down hotel or even hostel. To our surprise our room was HUGE! (especially coming off a cruise ship where our cabin was about 250 sq ft) and quite clean. Overall for a one night stay I would recommend this hotel especially if your about to board a cruise or your just disembarking but really nothing longer then a night. I would also recommend staying closer to Old San Juan since this hotel is located in Condado and is about a $15 cab ride to get there but is closer to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Vfoote2
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based on reviews. It turned out to be a great choice. Rooms nicely furnished and very clean. Overall maintenance of the room and bathroom was excellent. The sleep number bed was nice considering I had previously been contemplating purchasing one. No problem with A/C. Continental breakfast was plentiful and fresh. Because it's centrally located we didn't need to rent a car for the the first 3 days of our vacation because sites of interest and clubs were within walking distance or bus ride or short taxi ride away. Hotel parking rates were surprisenly cheap for the area, another reason to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Don't deliver what they advertise”
Reviews.Author: aggieastrosfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night precruise and one night postcruise, both in Ambassador Club rooms. Precruise was fine, even though the rooms didn't have the sleep number beds as advertised online. Postcruise was a disaster. We took our luggage to the hotel before doing our sightseeing. When we went back to get to our rooms, our luggage took well over an hour to show up. Our room keys didn't work at first, we had to have them re-keyed. The room next door had the alarm clock going full blast, it took them 2 hours to turn it off after I called. The hot water ran out on me in the shower. The bathroom door stuck and had to be slammed shut. The safe didn't work. The ice machine on our floor didn't work. The room had no refrigerator (not a huge deal, but it was advertised as having one). My in-laws called twice requesting batteries for their TV remote, they never got any. Oh, and the hallway was HOT. Uncomfortably hot. It was the same precruise as well. Precruise we were on the 6th floor (622), post was the 8th floor (832). We had no problems with noise, and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: NYDEB55
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Easter Sunday. Room was not ready, so the hotel upgraded me to a suite in the Ambassador Club (other room was there also). All good except had to ask for towels twice. Floor 8 would have been better, but I stayed on floor 6. Do not get a room facing the left side of the hotel because the garbage is picked up at about 4 am. The staff was very helpfull and friendly. The tour guide was especially helpfull. You can take the bus and the free trolly in Old San Juan and walk Old San Juan yourself. You can take bus 21 to Old San Juan, take the ferry to Catano and the bus van to the Barcadi Factory yourself. You will save about 75 dollars. We went on the rain forrest tour paid about 110 dollars for two. If you do not have a rental car then this tour was good. Visit the Carolina beach. It is near by via cab or bus. Yerba Buena restaurant accross the street has the best Mojitos! Bebo's Cafe also near by has very good and reasonable priced food. Restaurante AJili Mojili is expensive and overrated but the cornish hen did look very good. Joseesoj restaurant on Magdalena ave, very expensive but very good. I would go back if I could afford it.Cafeteria Mallorca in old san juan 300 San Francisto street, excellent coffee and Mallorca's. I went twice. Check out the Butterfly People store on calle de la cruz in old san juan. For authentic foods check out Las Paredes. Go in the daylight by bus or cab $20, and eat. Very cheap and good. I love Puerto Rico. I will have to go again because the island has a lot to see and do. Oh, visit the Las Plaza de Americas Mall. It is a very nice mall. There is good food in the food court. You can get there by bus or cab. Keep in mind, this is the caribbean so bus service is slow. If you are in a hurry then go by cab or tour and pay the extra money. Me. I took the 75 and 50 cent bus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: SherryWash
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 1 bedroom executive suite for five days, and if I must say this hotel was excellent considering that you were away from home. I definitely do not have one bad thing to say. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: HickeysGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in a great place, close to everything! The beach was just a block away, the comfort of the bed was to die for, the perks of the Ambassador Club were wonderful (free continental breakfast and appetizers each night), and the rooms were very nice. This was our first trip to Puerto Rico, and we would definitely love to return and stay at this same hotel. Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: MAREL52
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the hotel. We have been going there for more than 20 years. The hotel has definitely gone downhill. When we first started coming here it was a first class hotel. It seems now that all of the internet sites are offering very cheap rates. The continental breakfast has alot to be desired. The rooms need upgrading. The hotel has a terrible restaurant upstairs. The food is awful. Location Location is what keeps this hotel afloat. Great eating places right at your fingertips. There is a rooftop pool. No bar service at the pool. Casino is good. Not as much action as the Marriott right up the street. I just wish that the hotel would get its act together and put some money into it. Will I return? Yes it is like home to me..

Reviews.Title: “Great One Nighter before hitting up the cruise the next day”
Reviews.Author: CDN_Trav1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for night before our cruise, great location, great price, there's a burger king 2 minutes away and at night you can walk down the street and have ice cream and alot of restaurants, felt safe walking down and its only 5 minutes from the over priced marriott. you can kill a night just walking up and down the street right off the hotel, Also the Internet was free for guests and real quick too, killed an hour letting everyone know we made it to san juan and watch alittle bit of the hockey game Would recommend to anyone looking to stay for one night, the balcony is nice size you can smoke out there, the roof top pool is good, about a 5-10 minute walk to the beach, but not the greatest, but im guessing the most of P.R. caisno is good right in the lobby and you get free drinks upstairs. and the staff was healpful, read some reviews and i had a pleasant stay, get some people just had bad luck. lol Would recomend to anyone, espically if your only staying for the night, great value. great place, staying there again on our next cruise lay over

Reviews.Title: “In perspective”
Reviews.Author: Needyouradvice
Reviews.Content: Sometimes we have to put things in perspective considering the prevailing comparisons. When I compare the value I got for my room, this was a great choice. I was able to get a room here hundreds of dollars below other hotels. I needed something in a hurry as I got a last minute cruise and was flying in a couple days beforehand. I found the location excellent, safe, and nearby the beach and restaurants. My only complaints that I have would definately be the noise (as noted in other reviews). We had the AC cranked up to drown out the noise but we had a room next to the elevators. Ask for a room at the end of the corridor and high up and that might help. My wife did not like the comfort of the bed but I thought it was okay. Everything else was great including the service.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: sd9999
Reviews.Content: My family and I had to travel to San Juan for a funeral and we were able to book a last minute flight with hotel at Expedia.com. We got a great deal for two rooms at the Radisson's Ambassador club. If we didn't pay such a fair price, I would have been disappointed. The room was noisy and the roof deck pool was very uninviting. I think it's a decent hotel for a short stay (and you score a good price) or a business trip (and the company picks up the tab.) Don't pay a lot for this hotel as there are betters ones in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Dallmat
Reviews.Content: We paid about $400 per night for a 1 BR suite on the Ambassador Concierge level which offered continental breakfast and afternoon hors d'oevres. The thermostat in our room did not work. The temperature was about 65 deg. F. We were freezing. We complained twice without any response from maintenance. The hors d'oevres consisted of cubes of cheese, some crackers, crudite, small turkey and ham sandwiches on plain white bread rolls and a strange looking satay dish that may have been chicken. Soft drinks were $2.95 each. Beer was more. Parking was an additional $15 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Trying To Be Better... But...”
Reviews.Author: Zephyr-TA
Reviews.Content: Arrived 12/5 two nights staying in the suite area. After getting settled, we discovered the toilet was BADLY plugged (rm 703 I believe). Missing wash clothes also (provided shortly). Went to top floor reception and launched the complaint. Went to bar on casino floor and enjoyed the afternoon. Returned to room, one less bath towel (used for floor wiping) and tested... nope, still badly stopped. Was clear from scratches in bowl, this was not a new problem. Room should NEVER have been rented in this condition. Back to top floor reception, still busted, fix it and ALSO leave a plumber's helper. We left for dinner. One less towel after the second effort and no success. Told them if not fixed in morning while we were out, they would HAVE to move us, which they did but at the expense of packing and unpacking again. Second room (705 next door) was fine and fully ready except no hot water from 5-7 pm on Sunday 12/6. Message was not conveyed by evening desk to morning desk so I was a big surprise when I said "move me." Numbered beds were fine and all else in good shape. Continental breakfast was excellent. Evening snacks were ok, the usual cheese/veggie/plantain finger foods. Location excellent. Second floor restaurant was depressing, I think all casino restaurants are depressing. And on checkout, left 4 hanging shirts in wardrobe which I have not seen again - I assume donated to Salvation Army. They had my address, oh well, wishful thinking. On checkout at Monday, 12/7 9:30 am, no luggage help at the desk, had t haul our own. We could find no info on pool hours, breakfast and appetizer times in the room. Looked through the book but didn't see it. So, a normal chain hotel trying to be better and without more consistency in room prep and hot water making, they have a ways to go. The darn toilet really ruined our stay and thus my opinion is adjusted accordingly n the room evaluation. I did receive a very nice long note from housekeeping but it was too late. Water had gone over the dam if you know what I mean! Will find other digs in Condado next time!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay at Radisson”
Reviews.Author: Noisette
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to San Juan last April and enjoyed our trip very much, so we decided to spend Christmas in Puerto Rico. We stayed at the Radisson Ambassador Hotel in the Ambassador Club. We had a suite and the Numbers bed. Complimentary Continental Breakfast in the morning and a snack (sandwiches and cheese) was offered around 5:30 p.m. The service was great. We enjoy dancing, so the bar had music every night to which we could dance to. On Christmas day, there was a special party ''Bailable de Navidad'' at the Hotel San Juan. We enjoyed that also very much. There were 2 orchestras with 12 musicians each and the music was great. Rey de la Paz was also supposed to be present (but we left around 12:30 a.m.) and we didn't see him.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Def Recommend It”
Reviews.Author: MaLadyJane
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 nite pre cruise, lovely hotel and great location for the beach. Overall nice hotel and no complaints from me or hubby :) Need 2 mention the coctails in the sports bar Mmmmm delish

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Condado”
Reviews.Author: snarl71
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Ambassador Hotel and Casino for three nights in October 2009. We reserved online using CitiBank "Thank You" points, requesting an Ambassador Level room. After taking the glass elevator up to the top floor, we checked in and went down one floor to our room. The room was quite spacious and clean looking, with a good sized bathroom, expected modern amenities (individually controlled air-conditioning, built-in safe in the closet), plus a private balcony facing west. It offered glimpses of the beach a block a way (but there were occasional hi-rises blocked preventing unobstructed views). Still, the first night provided us with a gorgeous sunset from our balcony. The room was tidy and the bedding was crisp and clean. My biggest complaints with the room were that the carpet (though looking fairly new and unfaded) was buckling in spots. The other problem was with the hot water. On the first and second day, things were fine. But the last two days of the trip would find us with either limited hot water, or nearly no water pressure at all. It was all rather random so another shower an hour later would be fine. It wasn't a huge hassle for us, but if you're in a hurry to check out or catch a flight and want to be showered first, be warned. The common areas of the hotel were also nice. The long common corridors were broken up nicely with with mirrors, patterened carpet, and lighting. Staying in the Ambassador level also gave us access to the Ambassador Lounge on the roof level. This provided us with daily free breakfast (cereal, waffles, bagels, fresh fruit, yogurt, assorted juices, coffe/tea). In addition, every afternoon they offered free hot hors d'ouvres. Additinonally, upon check-in we received two free rum-based drinks from one of the hotel bars. Also on the roof of the building was a small, clean pool. On the ground floor of the property were a few bars and a popular casino. Despite the popularity and crowds downstairs, our hotel room was perfectly quiet. The location was also a key reason to stay at the Radisson Ambassador. It's located right on popular Ashford Street, where you'll find restaurants and shops. Around the corner you'll find Condado Beach. It's a smaller beach, with rougher waves, but was still quite nice (and has a gay section, if that's what you're looking for). Additionally, a short walk in the other direction brings you to Ocean Park Beach, which is much more expansive (and with slightly calmer seas). The hotel is also on the bus line (or short cab right) to Old San Juan. All in all, we had a nice stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, but quite OK”
Reviews.Author: luke.traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night before our cruise that left from San Juan. The hotel is quite nice actually, friendly welcome, and we got vouchers for 2 free drinks at the hotel bar. The bar had live latino music (Saturday night), but the music was VERY loud, we could only communicate by yelling at each other. However, the bar was packed full with locals who seemed to enjoy the music and dance. The room was nice, beds very comfortable, decoration was a bit dated, but OK. We enjoyed the little balcony. The bathroom was of adequate size. The taxi from the airport was USD 15.00 plus 1.00 per bag. Same fare to the Pan-American pier, where our ship was docked. Negative points? Yes, the hallways look shabby. One light in the bathroom was not working. But never mind, for the price we paid, it was a very good stay. I would stay at the Radisson again when back to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money in the Condado area”
Reviews.Author: prjoe05
Reviews.Content: The Ambassador Plaza has been hosting both tourists (because of its proximity to the beach and Old San Juan) and locals (because of the casino and lounge) for decades now. It has been renovated and it looks very good for its age, although it shows. A new wing has been added mostly for rental pool purposes. High rollers may feel at home here, because there are special accomodations and a particular lounge for them. The Ambassador Grill, the restaurant located on the premises, provides the hotel room service from 11 to 11 and the food is good. The rooms are bigger than normal, and they are clean, although the beds are not comfortable, and the bathrooms are clean but small. They have a small closet and a security safe. The TV is not plasma or high-definition and the movie and checkout services did not work during our stay, but that was compensated by the fact that there is free high-speed internet service with a good and steady connection. The staff is marginally courteous but competent enough. Self-parking is $12 per day, which is pretty good. There are many dining options nearby, as the trendy Condado district is known for that. All in all, a good value hotel that needs more modern decoration.

Reviews.Title: “definitely not”
Reviews.Author: calabria2009
Reviews.Content: i am returning to san juan for the second time in november. as i search for hotels on this site i keep coming back to this thinking i should have written about this sooner. spend an extra 50 bucks folks and stay elsewhere. tacky and shabby lobby. casino is outdated. the first day i got there was in the afternoon and there were room service trays laying around the halls (eew). strange little balcony and oddly configured room. i have stayed at radissons in the past and was not at all happy with this one. close enough to the beaches i guess but thats about all. never again.

Reviews.Title: “Power went out > 6 hours, rude to our complaints”
Reviews.Author: dragonrn67
Reviews.Content: This was our honeymoon! One morning, our third there, the power went out at 4am. We complained, and were told "no comps, you can charge breakfast to your room, and we will take it off later." We didn't want breakfast, we wanted electricity. Matilda, the front desk MANAGER, told us we were welcome to leave. Expedia put us up at a new hotel within 30 minutes of us calling, and verifying that the manager did indeed tell us to leave. I have never been treated so poorly by a hotel in all of my travels.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected...”
Reviews.Author: FloridaCouple97
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on our room, so I chose to ignore some of the less positive reviews. Glad I did. Great hotel, great location, excellent staff. Some issues with dirty carpet, as other reviewers have mentioned, but I notified the front desk and also responded to their survey after we checked out. Other than that, it was a wonderful stay. Enjoyed the casino a couple of times, easy parking if you rent a car. Quiet neighborhood, close to several restaurants and only a short walk to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: aretha05
Reviews.Content: i can really say that i enjoyed my stay at the radisson. the rooms were nice,the staff was friendly and the hotel was within walking distance to everything. i would definitely stay here again. i'm glad i ignored the negative reviews and decided to check this place out myself!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: vabchtraveler
Reviews.Content: There are lots of expensive hotels in San Juan - this one is mid-priced but still quite nice. I've stayed at the Radisson twice (several years between stays) and have been pleased both times. The hotel staff is extremely helpful and pleasant. As we were cruise customers both times, it was a relief that the hotel "kept" our luggage safe for us both before and after check-in times. All we had to do was have them retrieve it when we needed it - while we were free to enjoy Condado, or wherever. The hotel room was nicely appointed, clean, and mold-free - always an issue in tropical climates (even in mainland coastal areas). The Condado area is nice for an evening stroll to local restaurants. And we enjoyed day trekking in the morning to the souvenir shops and local restaurants. Several in our party also enjoyed the restaurant on premises - no complaints. The hotel is a short ride from the airport and about a $15 taxi to ship piers.

Reviews.Title: “A great alternative”
Reviews.Author: NYWillTravel
Reviews.Content: For half the price of what you would normally pay for a night on Condado's Ashford Avenue, I found this hotel by accident. The preferred hotels were booked solid but the Radisson had rooms available. At first apprehensive because of the low price, I found that the only drawback is the lack of a real ocean view. It is one block from the beach, with the view obstructed by another building. That's it. Otherwise, it is up to par with the other hotels in the area. The room was clean and comfortable, though not modernized. The staff was pleasant and responsive. The casino is quite large, leaving little room in the lobby area. A live band played in the lobby bar and both the casino and the bar attract many locals. The rooftop pool is a decent size and the view from the pool area almost makes up for the lack of a beach view from the rooms. There's a small fitness center and a spa on site. The hotel is convenientely situated near shops and restaurants. Overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “laptop, bag and contents stolen from room”
Reviews.Author: nerrian
Reviews.Content: I along with other family members stayed at this hotel several times a year, and liked it because it was comfortable for short stays and conveniently located. However, my laptop, bag and other contents were stolen from my room. To compound the situation, the manager was unapologetic and the matter still remains unresolved.

Reviews.Title: “Changed Hotels Mid-Stay. Horrific Service. Dirty Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kivness
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. It was so BAD that I left MID-VACATION because I was so horrified at the service and cleanliness of this hotel. From the moment I arrived, the service was rude and uninviting. Our room smelled musty and moldy. There was mold in the shower. There was mold in the shower. The hotel boasts a rooftop pool, yet the signs for the pool, rooftop bar and fitness center all boast hours that are incorrect. We were incredibly disappointed to find that upon entering the pool area, the pool was closed and locked off to guests. When we did attempt to enjoy the pool we found the pool bar wasn't open at all. We had to go back down to the casino to get a beverage. When I called for roomservice I had to make four separate calls to place an order, once placed it arrived almost an hour later. It was cold and one of the two parts of the order was wrong. I had to call five or six different numbers (concierge, roomservice, front desk, etc) before I got through to someone to tell them that the order was wrong. No apologies were made for messing up my order, when I asked to send it back they said that I should leave it outside. I asked to have something else brought and they said the kitchen was closed and I was out of luck. So there I was, over two hours later, now really hungry but unable to helped whatsoever. I asked for it not to be on my bill. The man at the front desk said no problem. We passed by the executive suites the next day to double check that we had not be charged. The woman working assured us that it had been taken off. Upon check out, we found it had not been taken off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Continental Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: lovePR57
Reviews.Content: I payed 228.00 a night this came with continental breakfast in the morning which was great. I expected just muffins and they had waffles, toast, cereal, fresh fruit. It was great. they hadappetizzers from 5pm to 9pm this was also wonderful because we didn't even go to dinner after we went there it saved us a lot of money. Parking was included, and the beach was 5 mins walking distance. This hotel is close to everything and the people were extra friendly. I read a review and took a chance I was very happy. The room needed a new rug; it was lifted but, when I complained they were very gracious and asked if I wanted to change to another room; which I didn't because I figured I could live with it.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the high cost”
Reviews.Author: RogerCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Radisson prior to a Cruise. The room is outdated, old, and needs remodeling. We could not believe what we saw for $270. It was in the Motel 6 category. We expected a sleep number bed, but were told they are only offered in the suites. The rooms need to be torn out, and replaced with new everything. It was old and run down. The small casino is small and smoky. The only thing I can say good about this hotel is that it is close to the airport and the service was friendly. The cost should not be over $100.00 . We have stayed at Hiltons, Westins and W's. This hotel is a joke at $270 for a crappy room.

Reviews.Title: “Our Raddisson Accomodations During Our Silver Wedding Anniversary Were Nice.”
Reviews.Author: megpang
Reviews.Content: We Celebrated our Silver Wedding Anniversary at the Radisson from March 5 through the March 9th.. We were members of the Ambassador's Club. In the last 30 years, we've visited P.R. on 8 occassions and have stay in Guest Houses, ESJ and various hotels. We recommend staying in Room 604 because we were impressed with the clean sunny room and the nice and friendly maids. In fact, one day we returned to our room at 8:00 p.m. to discover that we had 3 sets of Bath and Hand towels but no washcloths. My husband called Housekeeping and within 5 minutes a Hotel representative was delivering the washcloths (no kidding)! The bathroom was decorated very nicely (black marble), a large den and a very nice bedroom with two TV's ( one for each room). We enjoyed the live entertainment that was provided at the bar from Thursday through Sunday night. Great Dancing and it appeared that persons returning and departing for Cruises were there. The Hotel's parking lot were filled to capacity during those nights. I also like the convenience to the Condado shopping area. I found the Front and upper Penthouse representatives helpful and extremely polite and the Continental Breakfast was good. We even rented a car after receiving excellent instructions from the Front Desk clerk and located the Prime Outlets in Barceloneta. Despite the many clouds and windy March weather, we had an Enjoyable Stay at the Radisson and plan to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed With What We Got For Our Money”
Reviews.Author: 1937olds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ambassador on March 14th and 15th after our cruise. We had a 2 room suite on the 6th floor in the Gatsby Suites. For $209.00 a night, the room included free breakfast for 2 and free dinner for 2 at the Ambassador Grill. The reservation was made through our travel agent and I am not sure how we got the upgraded suite, but it was nice. Sleep number bed, new carpeting, black marble bathroom. Only complaint was "Jennifer" at the front was unfriendly and indifferent to deal with. All of the other staff was very kind and helpful. For the best beach area, walk three blocks to the Mariott and use the public beach there.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value, but lack of charm”
Reviews.Author: roamingmatt
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location, smack in the middle of Condado just a block from the beach. I got a good deal on the internet, USD 160 for an "Executive Suite". This turned out to be the same thing as an "Ambassador Suite", which is more expensive but also comes with extra services such as free continental breakfast on the 9th floor. I felt the hotel was functional, clean, had good amentities - but lacked in charm and atmosphere. It felt more like a "business hotel" than a "resort" (which is what I wanted). The room/suite was large and has all the advertised amenities: great bed, good and functional furniture, 2 TVs (since the suite is divided into 2 rooms), mini fridge, coffee maker, microwave (placed on the stool of a chair). I was lucky to be placed on the 7th floor, away from the casino/bar, and with a partial ocean view (peeking between other buildings) from the small balcony. I had free internet via cable (may only be for the suites). But as I said, don't expect a resort. The lobby is cramped considering the size of the hotel (the space is given to the casino), the color theme in the hallways is brown, and the room was also darkish (in my case the room was divided into 2 parts since it was a suite, and that also made the room darker). The rooftop swimming pool was decent size, good for sunbathing. No greenery at all. The beach is just 1 block away (2 counting from the hotel entrance on Ashford Av). Condado is a good beach, not the most chich since it's a public beach with a real mix of people. The rooftop hotel gym was, as expected, small. Newish machines, but few. There was a good size gym located about 5 blocks away in Ashford Av - called "International". Just go out the hotel entrance and take a right. They charge USD 15 for a daypass and have plenty of (oldish) machines. The beach is just outside. In summary, I think the Radisson was pretty good value, but lacked in charm.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, lacks modern facilities”
Reviews.Author: andrewclauer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ambassador for 16 nights during a business trip in late February/early March. I selected this hotel exclusively due to low rate that I found through radisson.com ($135/night). I have stayed at many other hotels in the Isla Verde/Condado/Old San Juan area on previous trips, and while my opinion of the Ambassador is certainly tainted by some of the other nicer properties (El San Juan, Marriott Stellaris, Intercontinental, Embassy Suites), the Radisson has a good location (though not beach-front) and again, represents a good value. I was fortunate to end up in one of their two-room suites, which provided ample room to live/work during the trip. The room itself was generally clean, and offered a small balcony (as do all rooms, I believe); however, the balcony overlooked the large surface parking lot. I am not a hotel expert (though I do spend 100+ nights per year in them), but this property strikes me as having such potential to be a great place. Unfortunately, that transformation from OK to great would require a large implosion and several hundred million dollars to affect. The good: location right on Ashford in Condado. Price. Room size (at least the suites). The staff were all friendly, helpful and pleasant. Everyone from front desk staff to the housekeepers. The just OK: The hotel is older. Its facilities are older, including the casino (which appears to mostly cater to the local crowd). The "gift shop" is old, rundown, is not affiliated with the hotel itself (can't charge to the room) and lacks any real selection. Room service was marginal, with food presentation poor. The property has an expansive surface parking lot (and small 2-3 story garage area) which is completely packed on certain nights (Thursday, Friday, Saturday). People park all over the place, blocking others in (and the valets stick cars everywhere too). This causes a lot of unhappy people when they was out of the casino 4 hours later, which invariably results in yelling, a lot of horn honking, etc. I have have noticed this more since my room was on the 5th floor, directly overlooking this ritual. I would consider staying here again for the same price while on a long business trip. If you're in town and don't want to spend a lot of money, and don't mind walking a block to the beach, this hotel is a good choice. If you're looking for fully modern amenities and big, exciting casino, there are better choices in the area. The real upside is the staff (and price).

Reviews.Title: “Noisy & Dirty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EricaLyn
Reviews.Content: Incredibly noisy hotel. We were given a room on the 2nd floor, right above the 24 hour casino and the nightclub. The bass thumped into our room well into the morning finally shutting off around 3-4 am. The street noise was loud as well. The evening front desk staff was curt and rude. We had to turn on the A/C full blast to drown out the casino and nightclub music and voices. The room carpet looked dirty so I wore my white booties while in the room. Just wearing them for a couple of hours over the course of two days showed that the bottoms were black from the dirt in the carpet. Disgusting. The best thing about the room was the bed. VERY comfortable. Everything else was dirty, old and well worn. We ate in the restaurant once and it was a huge mistake. Slow service. Horrible food. I ordered the local specialty Mufundo and it came in little balls that were still frozen inside. Mufundo is supposed to be in a casserole/loose type consistency. It was the weirdest thing. My husband ordered empandades and they were disgusting. Just awful food. Checking out was crowded, insane and unprofessional. They basically took our room card without so much as a thank you or come again. I can't believe this hotel is AAA rated. Believe me, AAA is going to hear about this hotel. Also the outside of the hotel is run down and ragged. The Condado is supposed to be the "South Beach" of San Juan. Hardly. You'll do much better paying more for the Old San Juan Sheraton, Caribe Hilton or a boutique hotel like the El Convento. The Radisson Ambassador is just plain awful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room, helpful staff...not a beacfront property.”
Reviews.Author: LYNNENY
Reviews.Content: We just completed our first visit to Puerto Rico where I found a very good deal on the Radisson via Hotels.com. We stayed on the 7th floor in a very clean and spacious room. (The carpet could have been newer is my only complaint about the room.) A very comfortable king size bed ! Good quality towels which I am fussy about. Lots of lighting in the room , too. Maid service was fine. The entire staff was helpful & congenial while we stayed here for 3 nights. Our questions were answered in a very friendly manner and every day we felt welcomed by various staff people as we got off the elevators etc. Our room also had an excellent air conditioner which is important to me. The seventh floor is very very quiet. Never a problem getting a taxi outside the front door..any time. We booked the Ambassador Package which included a deluxe continental breakfast..( it was listed on hotels .com as a full breakfast ) We have to say that if you didn't get to the pretty breakfast room before 8 AM then you didn't get much to choose from for your breakfast. The Radisson needs to replenish the breakfast items faster during the 530 - 930 AM times they provided this special breakfast to the guests on the 7th floor. You pay extra for this. There was no place to indicate this as I did not see any cards to write you comments on in our room or in the breakfast room. We did not use the pool which is pretty ...looked nice...it's on the roof . Our room had a balcony and a partial ocean view....there are no complete ocean view rooms as this is NOT A BEACHFRONT property. If you go into the casino at the Radisson..be forewarned in the evenings it gets very loud ...you can't hear yourself think. We did not eat at the Radisson 's restaurant only because we wanted to try restaurants on Ashford Ave to eat during our 3 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not much to do in Contado”
Reviews.Author: Googliana
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the value it offered on route to Cruise, based on Trip adviser recommendations that the beach and pool were nice. We found that the beach was too rough and it was too cool to swimming when we were there. With the beach out of the picture we would have been better off staying in Old San Juan. We loved Old San Juan, there was plenty to do and had great ambience. Contado is too far out and the $US15 taxi fare to Old San Juan is steep and taxis are not always easy to get esp on Fri and Sat nights. If staying for a short time stay in Old San Juan or otherwise check out some of nicer beaches/resorts around the island if you have more time.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from Radisson”
Reviews.Author: ICI01
Reviews.Content: The hotel has not changed much since I was here 5 years ago. rooms are still the same which means especially the carpet could do with a make-over. bathrooms have been redecorated some years ago. The thing that has changed for the worse is the restaurant. As I rember the last time I visited there was a decent restaurant on site and the buffet breakfast was very good. Now I could not find a restaurant and the breakfast was not to good with staff being very uninterested. So did this only once. Good restaurants available in the street some blocks away. Bed was OK and if you just go there to sleep it is a good option, but the price is still too high for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “A nice pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: engine643
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through Priceline for 140 bucks. Check-in was painless and the staff very friendly. Had a room on the third floor looking towards Burger King. Not the greatest view but did not really care. The room had two double beds which were comfortable and the bathroom was nice to say the least. Everything was very clean and if needed there was a safe in the room. There is a gym on the rooftop level along with a pool and a decent view towards the water. We arrived at 8 PM and walked up the street to get a bite to eat. Lots of people out and about and felt safe the whole time. Would be about a 7-10 minute ride into OSJ via taxi. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very good alternative”
Reviews.Author: golflover26
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel and we were very pleased with it. We got an excellent rate through Hotels.com. The room was very spacious, very clean, we loved the balcony, and the lobby bar with live music. The taff was very friendly indeed. The previous review to this one from a visitor from Canada depicts very well this hotel. It will definitely be our first choice for any stay in San Juan in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: shermanCanada
Reviews.Content: First time in Puerto Rico. Air Port was modern , clean and the staff was helpful and efficient. We stayed at the Radisson September 18 - 25 2008, room 240. The room was modern and clean. The staff was courteous and helpful. Housekeeping did a great job of cleaning up after us every day; they were friendly and eager to make our stay enjoyable. Every room has a balcony so it makes it easy to sit outside to have a smoke, there is no smoking anywhere. The pool on the roof of the Hotel was clean and the water was warm, the beach within one block was clean and safe for swiming. There are lots of Restaurants within easy walking distance from the Hotel. The buses are free and are easy to get to all the points of interest, no need to rent a car. There are 3 Casinos within easy walking distance from the Hotel. We have been to many Islands in the Caribbean and Puerto Rico is one of the cleanest, friendliest Islands we have been too and there are lots of Poice to make you feel safe. We would go back and yes we would stay again at the Radisson. Rick & Carol Stinson, Hamilton Ontario, Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Tortravelers
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Radisson. We stayed 6 days 5 nights for our 20th wedding anniversary. The hotel is great and the service excellent. Everything was very clean and the staff is friendly, helpful and courteous. The pool, the gym and the casino were our favorite places. The food was excellent as well as the entertainment. The hotel is located close to many stores and the Old San Juan. Transportation is available all the time. We stayed at other Radisson's (no need to mention the States) before but this is the best one. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in and we'll most likely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Radisson Ambassador - Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: jameskwebber
Reviews.Content: Organized a group of 14 to stay in 7 rooms at the Radisson Ambassador Hotel in Puerto Rico. Was disappointed that none of the rooms were available for check in at the designated check in time. Had to wait approximately 3 hours for the first room to become available and 5 hours for the final room to become avaialble. The hotel lobby could not accomodate the crowd waiting to check in and the staff was less then helpful with the numerous complaints from other guests checking in. Location is pretty decent, but does not look like the photo on the website. The beach that is close to the hotel can be accessed by a narrow street behind the hotel, but is not worth visiting due to the jagged rocks/trash on the beach. Be prepared to walk a few blocks down to get to the better portion of the beach. Plenty of good restaurants within walking distance and plenty of cabs out front willing to take you where ever you need. Overall, would stay again for the lower price.

Reviews.Title: “I'm ambivalent about the Radisson San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Juanita1913
Reviews.Content: Pros: 2 blocks to the Beach, In-house Casino, Shopping, Local restaurants or US chains (think Wendys, Starbucks, Subway, Chili's...). The neighborhood (Condado) is a mix of residential and small businesses, so it was well-lit and I felt safe walking around with my trip mate. Taxi's are ALWAYS available at the hotel and it's close to San Juan (10 min cab ride). The room itself was large and a bit outdated, but clean. The air conditioning worked GREAT (we like it very cold) and it came with free high-speed. I also had a balcony and could see the beach, which was nice. CONS: Food throughout hotel was average, at best. The Casino is kind of small - there's a much better casino at the Marriott next door. Housekeeping was SLOW and they never serviced our room before noon. Oh and expect the ridiculous resort taxes (charged in addition to the room rate and state). I'm not sure if I would return to the Radisson. Got a great rate through priceline but I think we'll try somewhere on the Isla Verde side next time. It's definitely a great option for the budget friendly traveler or even pre-cruise stays, but I would reconsider if you plan to stay for longer than that.

Reviews.Title: “A little pricy”
Reviews.Author: traveljunky81
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay, clean and air conditioned. Decent service, price was a little steep but not overly compared to others in the area. Paid $300 for 4 people.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel if it was under $100 a night”
Reviews.Author: KC_FLA
Reviews.Content: Service wise it was better then the Radisson in Melbourne Florida. San Juan had bell man and concierge in the lobby to help out. Our room had a view of the street and we kept hearing a banging noise from (maybe) the water pipes. We were able to tolerate it but it could definitely drive many guests crazy. There are also balcony rooms on the other side that overlook the parking lot and we wish we had gotten one of those. Entertainment wise it was great. The casino is there. They do deal Blackjack a little bit weird here. They had a lounge with Salsa music both nights that we were there. If you like to dance with an older crowd, this is the place. Take the elevator ride to the rooftop pool it is pretty cool. No good views from this hotel. It is blocked from the beach by other buildings. The restaurant was overpriced and not much better then a sports bar. Wander a block down the street to much better restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Radisson I've Ever Seen”
Reviews.Author: Selkie211
Reviews.Content: I can't believe Radisson puts its name on this hotel. Most of the reception people are barely cordial and gave us wrong directions twice, though the telephone operators are very kind and helpful. The rooms are very dirty, wtih stained carpeting. The bathroom floors do not look as if they are washed but only swept. Towels are rough and cheap. There is good entertainment in the casino bar, but in that tiny place, the music is cranked up so loud that it hurts your ears. The place is set up very disjointedly, one elevator was out of service the whole week, the restaurant is down in a basement without windows, etc. Messages were delivered wrong. The water has a terrible chemical smell. Shower leaked and barely put out water. There was always a loud clanking in the wall whenever we used the water. This is definitely not up to Radisson standards, and I have stayed at several places in San Juan that were much nicer than this.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel - Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ebethOH
