Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week long stay at the Radisson San Juan. I had read some bad reviews here and was slightly nervous about my pick but overall the hotel was just what I expected it to be! The taxi from the airport was $16. We checked in at the lower lobby without a problem. We had read that we could check in upstairs at the Ambassador Club but it wasnâ€™t busy so we didnâ€™t have to worry about that. We had a one bedroom suite in the Ambassador Club. The living room had a seating area, desk, TV, sink, and small fridge. The bedroom had a sleep number bed and another TV. The bathroom was a decent size. We never had turn down service with chocolates or the robes that are advertised but I didnâ€™t bother asking for these services. From our balcony we could see the ocean in a couple spots and actually could see the ocean from our bed. The dÃ©cor was not fancy at all but all I was looking for was a somewhat roomy place to stay in close to Old San Juan with a refrigerator. The hotel was pretty clean. The nightly happy hour is from 5:30-8:30 with some appetizers â€“ cheese, veggies, small sandwiches and a hot breaded ham and cheese something. The drinks are on an honor system so you pour them yourselves and record what you drink. The managerâ€™s special is on Thursday from 5-8pm (the book in the room says itâ€™s on Wednesday). Free drinks and about twice as much food including a pasta dish and salmon pieces. This was the one time we saw the Ambassador Club crowded! We just came back from the beach and were the most down dressed people there! The continental breakfast in the Ambassador Club included cold cereal, fresh fruit, cooked oatmeal, bagels, and muffins. Thereâ€™s a coffee machine with good cappuccinos and lattes! The deal I booked on Radissonâ€™s website included two eggs cooked any way and choice of breakfast meat. The two desk clerks I talked to didnâ€™t know what I was talking about. I probably could have talked to a manager but instead I called my travel agent and she straightened everything out for us. Somehow it got us access to the full buffet (which cost $13) in the Grill which was pretty good. It annoyed me that the deal that was advertised was difficult to get. Remember to PRINT out a copy for your records â€“ and to prove to the hotel workers what you are supposed to get! The pool at the roof level was pretty cool! We took towels from the pool area with us to the beach multiple days. The lounge bar had people in it most every night. There was live entertainment every evening. Apparently this is where locals come for a casino and entertainment. There isnâ€™t a concierge in the hotel which disappointed me. The operator, Mannie, was helpful with restaurant ideas and provided a map with many restaurants and other businesses listed on it. There was also a tour desk which was manned by a Sunshine tour representative. We booked a tour through the rep to the BioBay in Fajardo. We were transported to Fajardo in a 15 person van and kayaked thru mangroves to a lagoon. Here the little critters in the water glow when disturbed! Very cool! The thing I liked the best about this hotel was itâ€™s LOCATION!!! The Condado area was a great place to be for a week. We tried three different beaches within walking distance of this hotel and each one was better than the next. The small beach which is the closest was the first one we hit. Pretty rocky and very small. The next beach we went to was about a mile walk away on Ashford Ave, the Condado Bridge Beach. There were rocks blocking the waves from the beach and made the beach very calm. There was a bit of seaweed farther into the bay but a great beach with plenty of water to play in. We rented beach chairs for $4 each and had a great afternoon here. The last beach we went to was by the Marriott. We accessed the beach on the street just past the Marriott. It was a nice long beach with fun waves. Rented beach chairs here for $3 each. This was the best beach of the three we went to. The restaurants in Condado were also great! We went to Yerba Buena (good mojitos), and Mmmoâ€™s Argentinan Grill (try the combo that includes eight types of meats â€“ and the sangria was great!), and Dannyâ€™s International CafÃ© (good pizza). We also went to Bangkok Bombay (a Thai & Indian place), and Ikakos (great seafood). My favorite restaurant was Beboâ€™s. Itâ€™s a place where the locals go and looks like a big cafeteria. The Mofongo here was awesome! Mofongo is mashed plantain with seafood or chicken mixed in. All these restaurants were no more than a 10 minute walk away from the Radisson. There is also a Burger King, Subway and Starbucks close by for those that want familiar food. We couldnâ€™t find too much nightlife in this area but Old San Juan is only a $12 cab ride away and it sounded like there was tons of nightlife there. Condado is a mostly residential location. There are more condos than hotel rooms in this area. It was great eating outside a restaurant and seeing people walking their dogs, going for a run (lots of runners), or taking the baby for a walk. There were only a couple of panhandlers and they werenâ€™t bothersome at all. I felt very safe walking along Ashford Ave all day and night. I am most definitely going back to San Juan and plan to stay in the Condado area. I might stay in the Radisson if a good deal is being offered. All in all the Radisson is a decent, basic hotel. It was clean, the people working were nice enough, the hotel bar had entertainment every night, the breakfast was OK and the pool was cool. The Radisson is NOT a resort! Do NOT expect bend over backwards treatment. Do NOT expect fancy rooms. If your expectations are a basic hotel room in a great area with close access to the beach then youâ€™ll be fine here!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: tainok
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends were visiting Puerto Rico for the Fisrt time. We were going for a three day concert Of Olga Tanon. The Hotel was ncie, since we had an ambasaddors room we had to check in the Penthouse upstairs. That was not an issue , the receptionists did not greet us with a smile nothing, seemed like she was bored of her job. But it was ok checking in, like 5 minutes. our room was in the 6 floor. when the elveator open it was a beautiful grand entrance, i liked the room very much, it had a small fridge too. The balcony was nice but i wished the view was to the beach its not but the great thing about it around the corner two blocks away is access to a beautiful beach. room serice came everyday, we had towels , water, and chocolates everyday. on the street were the hotel is ashford avenue tehre is alot of restaurants and nightlife there. Really nice. I had no problems throughout my stay.The pool upstaris is nice and there are chairs and free towels, also the business center is very accesible. teh view form the top is great...I would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Choose Another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iflyforfun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here before a flight to Dominica earlier this year. The location was outstanding but the hotel itself left room for much improvement. Based on the physical structure of the building we assumed it was not constructed to be a Radisson. It has an overall feeling of â€œdisjointednessâ€�. The taxi dropped us at the entrance to the hotel which is actually on the side of the building. There was no one to greet us and help with luggage. This would present a problem for older guests or people with disabilities. The lobby entrance is dark, thick with cigarette smoke and generally feels dreary. We paid for Ambassadorâ€™s Club level services and it was a waste of money. The room itself was average and the bathroom was tiny. However, on the plus side, the Sleep Number bed was outstanding. We were supposed to have complimentary bathrobes and had to call for them. Another service we paid for was nightly turndown service which we never received. The room safe did not work properly so we requested service. The â€œexpertâ€� came and whatever he did left the safe still not working. Hot breakfast was supposedly included with the cost of the room; it was not. The hotel is constructed in such a way that many things simply do not â€œflowâ€� physically. One selling point for the Ambassadorâ€™s Club is private check-in and check-out but this is done on the top floor of a separate tower. The swimming pool and billiards room are also located in a separate tower. We expected that at the very least they would provide a written explanation of where things were located on the property but that didnâ€™t happen. This made for a frustrating stay to say the least. Overall, we felt we paid far too much money for what we received. Weâ€™ve stayed at much cheaper hotels with nicer accommodations and better service. Checkout was a zoo and the clerk was not the least bit concerned that we were dissatisfied. We were scheduled to stay at the Radisson on our way back from Dominica but changed our hotel. Completely separate from the Radisson, the location is outstanding. There are several stores and some great restaurants within walking distance â€“ be sure to check out Yerba and the Asian Fusion restaurant down the street. The local bus (Number 21) costs only 75 cents and goes to Old San Juan. If you feel like walking about an hour, you can walk to Old San Juan. The beach is a couple of blocks from the hotel. We strolled along the main street at night and never felt threatened in terms of safety. There were always tourists and joggers out and about. We do not recommend the Radisson but do highly recommend this area of San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, But Ready To Try Someplace Else”
Reviews.Author: BHL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights in February '08. I booked my reservation directly with the hotel and had a suite on a concierge floor. Part of the attraction was that the package included complimentary continental breakfast, and also an honor bar/happy hour. When I arrived for check-in, I was told I that because I had an Ambassador Club reservation, I should check in upstairs in the club, located on the penthouse level. Unfortunately, I wasn't directed to the proper elevator bank, so it took me a while to find the right place. There a woman was waiting with the key to my room. I'd been told downstairs that she would explain all of the amenities due to me, but she had little to say, and only answered my questions with as short a reply as she could muster. Not my best first impression. Also, it seemed counter-productive to send me up to the penthouse to check in, only to have to go back downstairs to my room, all the while toting my luggage. I stayed in a mini-suite on the 7th floor. The living room had a TV, desk and chair, two arm chairs with an ottoman, a fridge and wet bar with a complimentary bottle of water. The front room had no windows and was rather dark, but the bedroom was bright and sunny, with ocean views off the balcony, another TV, a loveseat, a king-sized sleep number bed, and plenty of storage space. I found the decor rather staid, though, brown tweeds and greens, not the brighter, more tropical color scheme I would have expected. Nevertheless, everything was clean and seemed to be in working order, and I loved sitting on the balcony in the evenings listening to the sound of the coqui. It was convenient having plenty of cabs lined up outside the hotel whenever I needed to go anywhere. There are plenty of restaurants of a nice variety within walking distance, and Ashford Avenue is sort of the main drag in Condado for restaurants. However, if you're looking for souvenir shops this is not the place to be. The beach is only about a block and a half away, but there were high surf warning signs posted, and I saw only a few people on the sand. Also, the winds were so strong it was almost unpleasant to be down there. I tried the happy hour the first night. You fill out your own bill, which then gets added to your room charge. The bar is moderately stocked, and it's all do-it-yourself. Mixed drinks were somewhere around $4.25, but I paid $2.25 just for a small bottle of ginger ale. The hors d'oeuvre were nothing to write home about: some cheese cubes with crackers, crudites, and one hot dish of sliced sausages with onions. The continental breakfast the next morning was slightly better appointed, with fruit, hot & cold cereals, yogurt, breads and pastries. However, I didn't take advantage of either service after the first time. When I wanted a heartier breakfast I ate in the Ambassador Grill, which is only reached by going all the way downstairs and crossing over to a separate elevator that only takes you there. They have a pretty comprehensive breakfast buffet for something like $12.95. I went to happy hour at the grill once as well. It's 2-for-1, and on Thursdays it's ladies' night at the lobby bar, where ladies drink free. We tried to go there, but the live entertainment was so loudly horrendous that we retreated to the calmer environs of the restaurant. I wasn't impressed with any of the live entertainment I saw during my stay there, although the small lobby lounge was always full. A better choice is to go to the Marriott in Condado. On Saturday nights they have live salsa and merengue bands in the Lobby Lounge, and huge bar area as soon as you enter the property. Drinks and entertainment were much better than at the Radisson, and it's only about a 5-10 minute walk away. I found the staff friendly enough and very responsive the couple of times I called upon them, other than the woman working in the Ambassador Club. I also had turndown service in the evenings. My only complaints were that the elevators really did not work well. The one in the restaurant refused to go down one day when I was on it. When I went back to the hostess station to report it, she didn't seem surprised at all, and directed me out through a back way. Also, the single elevator that served the tower in which I was staying would often balk before it would finally go downstairs. Also, while my friend on the 8th floor said she couldn't hear a thing in her regular room, there was this annoying noise coming from either upstairs or next door to my room the entire time I was there, at all hours. So that, combined with the fact that I couldn't seem to identify my "sleep number", led to some restless nights. I would recommed this hotel, but not overly enthusiastically. I am already planning another trip back, but this time plan to stay in Old San Juan. That's where I ended up taking cabs to most of the time, and at $12 a pop I figure I might as well stay down there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: Ducksoop
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine for a stay of a night or two (we stayed there one night before our cruise), but if you're planning an extended stay in San Juan there are much better choices. The hotel is in the heart of the city so there is no view of the ocean or easy beach access, but there is a roof top pool if you want to swim or enjoy the sun. The casino on the first floor appears to be popular wih the locals. The lobby is small and a bit gloomy, and the staff at the desk is not particularly friendly. A little more smiling and a few pleasantries would go a long way towards improving the welcome. I imagine they must get a lot of people pre/post cruise because the attitude of the staff is to get you processed without fanfare and get your luggage out of the small lobby. We arrived in the early afternoon and were given what must be the most undesirable room in the hotel (or at least I hope there are none worse). The entire view from our balcony was the equipment for the hotel's cooling system and the roar of the compressors was very loud (our balcony was virtually unusable because of the roar). There was also a large spotlight mounted on the wall outside our balcony which made it very bright at night. I suspect the hotel would have given us a discount if we had complained but since we were only there for one night we didn't bother. (I recommend you request a room away from the AC equipment when you make your reservations--the noise is quite loud and a light sleeper would not have a restful night). The room was a bit dark but nicely decorated and was comfortable. When we first arrived in our room we found the carpets covered with a sticky powder of some sort, but in all fairness after we called housekeeping a lady quickly appeared with a vacuum cleaner and the carpets looked fine afterwards. Otherwise, the room was clean and well maintained and the bathroom was very basic but spotlessly clean. This hotel is an okay choice if you need a convenient place to stay before your cruise (the cruise docks are about 5 minutes away by taxi) and it is within walking distance of several dining spots and shops. There is a terrific place for breakfast just block away which will serve you a delicious full breakfast and a killer cup of cafe con leche for about $7. All in all, we would probably stay there again but I would make double, triple sure to get a room away from the mechanical equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night pre cruise. Fine hotel for one night, but no more. Front desk staff rude. I had a regular room reserved and wanted to see about upgrading to their club level. All I got out of my mouth was any chance to get a room on the club level. I couldn't even finish saying I would pay to upgrade. He must have thought I wanted to get the upgrade for free. Immediately he spit out NO. They were not sold out, had plenty of rooms open as a met someone later that night that book a room off the street on the club level. They advertise sleep number beds in all rooms. That is a lie. Only the suites have them. Our room faced the burger king and we could here the drive through window orders while sitting on the balcony. Only one elevator worked. Drinks in casino bar were expensive. I don't mind paying, but not $8.50 per drink in a plastic cup with hardly any booze in it. Starbucks is close by and a few restaurants. Beach is a block away, however not very good. Only about 10 minuted ride to old san juan. Plenty of Cabs waiting outside.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for One Night”
Reviews.Author: MA99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-cruise one night - 24 of us total. Not bad for one night. We ate at the grill for lunch - food and prices were good! Rooftop pool was nice we actually all hung out there at night and ordered pizza. This hotel is in the heart of the San Juan and honestly not in the best area especially at night. Lots of homeless people right outside hotel. Pool was chilly - not many enjoying it - surprising because air temp was so hot 86. Check in/out was a breeze - just not sure I would stay more than one night. They had some problems with there sewer because the a.m. we were checking out, they were attempting to clean/air out. The smell was horrendous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ambassador Club Room for cheap”
Reviews.Author: here2help
Reviews.Content: We were overnighting in San Juan before catching a flight. We just needed a nice place to stay so we used Priceline to bid. Wow did we luck out. Not only a room at the nice Radisson for $90 but an Ambassador Club Room! We were on the 7th floor, right next to the elevator and ice machine, convenient location and no noise at all. The room was as expected for the hotel rating. Comfortable and clean. Cable internet. Room service was a wee bit slow. The roof top pool was a nice place to relax. The water too cold for me to enjoy but that didn't stop others. Towel supply ran out but were delivered not too long after requested. There is a gym work out room on the roof top also. The Ambassador Club Lounge, adjacent to the pool area, was very comfortable and had snacks, honor bar, coffee dispensers and such. Not the best Club Lounge, but not at all bad. They had a business center with high speed computer and printer. I was the only one in the room, there were several other computers, all in private cubicles. The hotel location was near good restaurants, the beach and small shops. For $0.75 we took bus #21 to Old San Juan. The taxi is $15. This area of town was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “What a night!!!”
Reviews.Author: TamishaPorter
Reviews.Content: I am very dissapointed in my stay at the Radisson Ambassador. I've stayed their before and I've always been pleased with each and every stay however, this stay was ridiculous. I checked in around 5:30 p.m. and was given room 236. From the time I came, there were men running up and down the corridors laughing and running up the hallways. I figure that there was a bachelor party going on. I still thought it was inappropriate for them to put us on a floor with them (It was me and my kids). Nevertheless, I assume the noise was going to quell as night became morning. At five o'clock in the morning, my son was woked up by a loud nock on our door. He told me that he was unable to get any sleep because there were noise all night and the loud nocking on the door scared him. I am a travel agent, and before I recommend a property I usually evaluate them. After this weekend, I give Radisson Ambassador 2 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Almost exceptional”
Reviews.Author: time2play
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel and my expierence was almost perfect. First off I want to say that the front desk check in clerk Rene Vargas was absolutely exceptional. We had arrived early but he was able to get us a room while providing exceptionally friendly fast service. A+++ to that guy! Just a few things... The safe was not set upon arrival and had no instructions how to use it. It took several calls to get someone up to my room to get the safe working. Secondly the room faced the Burger King which totally sucked because 90% of the reason I stayed at this hotel was because it had a balcony... You could not really sit on the balcony without having the Burger King exhaust blowing in your direction. Lastly, I was quoted 18% tax but that has changed to 22% PLUS $5 per person per day tax for ??? It wasnt the worst thing in the world but it really seems high especially since when I called the hotel about it they didnt seem to know what exactly these charges were. I still give the hotel an excellent rating for service & cleanliness and Rene Vargas is the perfect person to have greeting guests!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wonderful Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: SINABUNS78
Reviews.Content: Okay we went to Puerto Rico for a short stay 2 nights 3 days! And I roomed with two other extremely picky people so I prayed that the negative reviews that I have read were wrong! And honestly they were!!! None of the other two roommates had even one single complaint and the housekeeping staff actually cleaned unlike other hotels I have stayed at! They were helpful with directions and especially in choices on were to eat! Check out Bebos and ESPECIALLY the famous Parrot Club in Old San Juan.....you will not believe your eyes or taste buds! 6 Thumbs way up Radisson you did good! Now my friends will trust me to book all of our trips....I just hope the next hotels don't dissappoint me!

Reviews.Title: “A+ Visit!”
Reviews.Author: lieberums
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a package. The hotel/casino is in Condado, conveniently located to lots of tourist stops and within a very short walking distance to the beach and other hotel casinos; plus, it's easy to find. The property is lovely, and the customer service is simply terrific. Our room was comfortable and clean, with a sleep number bed and a balcony as bonuses for us. The staff is very friendly and hospitable in the hotel services areas (front desk, housekeeping, valet), casino, and restaurant. The people of Puerto Rico are so sweet and humble in their pride of their homeland, with lots of people giving us their wishes to enjoy their "little island." We went to several other hotel/casinos during our stay, and definitely thought the Radisson had the most fun atmosphere--clean, friendly, lively, no waiting on drinks (or the yummy little warm sandwiches provided in casinos!), and great live music was playing every night, with dancing in the bar and foyer--so festive! There is a lot of "saving" of slot machines here and in every casino, but that's just the way it works down there and should just be accepted as part of the culture. The drink system is a little different, too, with the waitstaff appearing to obtain some kind of permission or voucher from the pit bosses; a player's card will ensure free drinks, but otherwise, I'd say you should probably let the pit boss know you're a hotel guest. Our stay at the Radisson definitely contributed to us having a wonderful trip to this beautiful island, which is American enough to be comfortable and Latin enough to be different and exotic.

Reviews.Title: “Choose Another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TCP64079
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a few nights at the Radisson. If you want or need to stay in the Condado area of San Juan, I would not recommend the Radisson. Three weeks before arrival, I specifically requested a room AWAY from the elevators and ice machine (noise factor). Upon arrival at the front desk, I again asked for a room away from the elevators and ice machine. The clerk made no comment. Well, sure enough, when I got to my room (531) after check-in, what did I find. The hotel was not nearly full, but my room was directly across from the elevator and the ice machine backed against my wall. The view was of the rooftop air conditioners on the 4th floor. I just said to myself to forget it and if it gets too bad, I will demand to be moved, The remote control to the television did not work, so I had to call and have it replaced. The room safe was locked and I called the desk to have someone to come up and open it - that never happened! Overall, the nights in the room were quiet enough so I did not complain about it anymore. However, upon checkout, I mentioned that I had wanted to use my room safe, but it was locked and no one ever came to open it. I was THEN told that the safe in the room was broken and didn't work. I thought that was unacceptable - to have a broken room safe in a casino hotel. (A very dirty casino I might add.) I will not stay at this hotel again. I would highly recommend paying a few dollars more (if any) and stay just down the street at the Marriott. The hotel and grounds there are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: OrganmanBrooklyn_NY
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not really too bad, but the hotel workers are incompetant. The front desk manager Ayende is unaccomodating. The two people who apologized for the runaround we had to endure was the bell boy and Rene. The rest of the staff, Jennifer, and the very incompetant Negron were the worst. The rooms are nothing to write home about. If you need to spend more than a day in San Juan, don't do it here. This place is a disgrace to the Radisson name.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: luna6373
Reviews.Content: stayed at this great hotel for 7 days with my partner and felt welcomed and spoiled by the staff ! was impressed with the hotel.and the hotel staff they where proffesional,very nice and attentive to our needs. had a nice clean room with a great view off the balconey.stayed on the club floor with turn down service. it was a great treat to come back to my room after a long day and have the room freshend up with a chocolate on my pillow.the house keeping staff where so outgoing and friendly and very attentive to all our needs. the pool on the roof was awsome with great 360 views of the greater san juan area close to the beach close to stores resturants and public transit they have a casino and a little nite club on the premises and a rent a car depote as well.only 20 minutes to old san juan via the bus.just in front of the hotel. i love this place cant wait to go back its as close as youll get to being home lots of great memories here thanks........

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay coming back”
Reviews.Author: siciligirl
Reviews.Content: I was so happy with my stay there the pool on the roof the service especially front desk manager Abraham outstanding I'M so satifsy going back there again in feb 2008 just one bad thing hertz rent a car very poor service also ambassador grill food and service horrible waiting 2 hours for our burger nasty waiter but hotel excellent by the way I got best tan on that roof top pool puerto rico is beautiful I WILL BE BACK THANK YOU CARMELA LOPRESTI

Reviews.Title: “Fine for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: shoegal1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before joining our cruise ship. We arrived at 1am- air con was blissfully cold but check in was painfully slow. We were the first in line and it still took just over 15 minutes. People at the back of the line told us it took them over 90 minutes- not what you need after you've been travelling for nearly 24 hours. Hotel itself was a little gaudy- tackily decorated and not exactly stylish or modern. However, rooms were fine and the beds were very comfortable- had a great nights sleep. The pool on the roof top seemed nice enough- clean with plenty of sunbeds. I wouldnt choose this hotel again if I had a choice but if you have already booked then there's nothing to worry about.

Reviews.Title: “It's nice...no worries”
Reviews.Author: happywhilewaiting
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on a Saturday about 1045a. The hotel lobby was packed. It took us over 30 minutes to be helped and then had to wait another 30 minutes for a bellboy to store our luggage until the room was ready. I will say in their defense a cruise ship had just arrived back in port. But, they only had 1 front desk guy working and only 2 bellboys. While we waited for our room we headed up to the pool on the roof. It's small, but very nice and clean. Plenty of chairs and they even provided towels. We enjoyed the time just basking in the sun and relaxing. We got our room around 330p and we pleasantly surprised by what we saw. For a standard hotel room it was huge. We even had a balcony. The view was of the Burger King next door, but when you're a smoker any balcony is good. The hotel is not right on the beach, but it's not a far walk. There's plenty of restaurants close by. And about 3 doors down is a market. We did visit the casino. It's totally non-smoking. For most that would be great, but for a smoker it was annoying. Be advised that in San Juan EVERYONE saves seats at the casino. Not only do you see tons of machines with no one there, but the cards still in or the chair tilted up. But, most people play two machines at once. So, good luck finding a machine to actually play. Overall, I thought the Radisson was nice. I wouldn't stay a week here on vacation, but for 1 or 2 nights it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: deebrant
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from March 8th - 16th. Our hotel from view from the little balcony we had was of Burger King...No big deal to us because we weren't planning on staying in the hotel much besides to sleep and shower. The employees were great! We had so many questions on things to do, places to eat, and fun places to be at night and they gave us very helpful hints. The breakfast buffet was like any other hotels buffet in the US. It had eggs, pancakes, yogurt, fruit, juice, toast, bagels, coffee, milk, and more. The beds were fine and believe me I've stayed in many hotel beds that were worse than this one. If you get a suite you get sleep numbers. Yes, there was renovation at the hotel, but you have to remember any hotel is going to have renovation in order to keep it up to date a, customers happy, and looking great! The area around the pool was getting worked on, but not the whole thing. It didn't really bother a group of 8 girls that were there for spring break. Overall I would reccommend this hotel to other people traveling in Puerto Rico. We had a great time...if it didn't meet our expectations we wouldn't have stayed there for 8 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience. Will Come Again”
Reviews.Author: lumisan1963
Reviews.Content: This property is almost good. I was there from Feb 4 to 7 and there were doing various repair jobs around. One elevator was down. The Casino is always alive with people and taxis are always there to take you around. The breakfasts were great & the lunches terrific. I recomend the coconut shrimp. The staff here are quite attentive, and know their english very well. there is a pizza & beer delivery to your room for 16.00. Its good.The pool on the top floor is greatThere is a Burger King next door & a Starbuck 3 minutes walk away. Interestingly, there is a Walgreen 5 minutes walk away with lovely gifts and all the Walgreens stuff. Some restaurants on Ashford Ave.served terrible food @ high prices, beware oif them. Ask the Taxi driver for Wai kiki. They are good. There are lots of hotel on Ashford Ave. But the Raddison is good

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Tfish
Reviews.Content: Better than expected for the money. ($130 on Hotwire) Upgraded us to renovated Club section. Suited us fine for a pre-cruise hotel. Would stay again for the rate

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: Andreari
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Radisson for one week on our 2 week honeymmon to Puerto Rico. Originally we were assigned to a room on the 4th floor, but the lock to the door was broken, so we were upgraded to a room on the second-to last floor (at the top). The room was extremely clean, there was a small fridge, microwave, a sitting area, a small balcony (overlooking burger king), and a nice very nice and big bathroom. We enjoyed the pool on the top floor (wasn't very busy) and the hotel staff was extremely friendly. Didn't have food at the hotel because there were plenty of places to eat on the same street as the hotel. Took a local bus a block away from the hotel to Old San Juan and felt safe the entire ride there and back (much cheaper option than taking a cab). Music is nice at the little bar at night as well. The beach is close to the hotel (about 2 blocks) but it was very small. Not what I envisioned as a beach in Puerto Rico. Overall we had a GREAT time and would recommend it to our friends. We plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about Radisson...”
Reviews.Author: cjennyjen
Reviews.Content: As a young family, we don't get the chance to take extended vacations very often. This last leg of our trip included a four night stay at the Radisson Ambassador Hotel. The room was nice, though we wanted two double beds, and received a king. It was a typical room with typical amenities. There are a couple good and bad points about this hotel I want to share. First, the parking situation is ATROCIOUS! We arrived back at the hotel at various times in the evening, only to find the parking lot extremely full. You have the choice of valet, but it costs more. We discovered the next morning, there were only a handful of cars left in the lot. This meant that casino gaming visitors took up all the parking meant mainly for hotel guests. We were on the third floor and could hear a lot of the casino noise from downstairs. Another thing you don't find out until you arrive are the parking fees were $15.00 per day. The hotel didn't express much sympathy when we brought this inconvenience to their attention upon checkout. The front desk reply was "Yes, we are quite a busy hotel" ONe thing I want to rave about is the proactive action taken by the hotel housekeepers. My daughter still loves her milk, so I bought a half gallon at the store and chilled it in the ice bucket. The next day when we got back from our busy day, we found a small fridge in our room with the milk chilled nicely inside. I was very impressed by this. I guess we made a mistake staying at a hotel with a casino in it. So if you don't want the parking hassle and the noise from a casino, definitely don't book your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Was fab! ”
Reviews.Author: BImtraveller
Reviews.Content: I am from the island of Barbados and I work for the premier All-inclusive Resorts there which is the Almond Beach Resorts Inc. So this will tell u I have knowledge of hotels. Radisson was so great my family and I vacation there Sep 2006 we had a deluxe Suite which had a kings size bed which was nicely made patio outside my room I has microwave and fridge in my room along with a coffee maker. It was not only a nice room but very clean and smelt clean my baby girl was give a crib on arrival for her sleeping comfort. The staff everyone of them I came in contact with was so nice, helpful and friendly they were the best.. People u pay for what to get I Pay about $500 usd for two nights there it was worth every cent; my money well spent. As there is a god above I tell u this hotel is a very good hotel and i will continue to stay there whenever I visit Puerto Rico. My only problem is that I paid $100 usd security on my room and on checking out the Computer system was down and I was unable to receive my my money back it was to be mailed to me this is October now and I have not seen a cent back as yet but in saying that I was allowed a late check out free of charge so can't have a cow over that. But it was great staying there I will go again. There is subway, Burger King next door there is a walgreens up the block there is great hospital down the block very good health care there YES I experianced the hospital there as well. Get restaurants around the hotel are great and the beach is within walking distant as well.

Reviews.Title: “Don't come here looking for luxury”
Reviews.Author: Liv101
Reviews.Content: Think twice about what you want your vacation to be before you stay here. The hotel is in a convenient location with some nice restaurants around it. The sushi place across the street was excellent. The lobby is VERY smoky and you can smell the smoke in the hallways of the upper floors. The rooms are mediocre. The pool is not wonderful. If you're looking for a luxurious vacation this is not the place to stay. My boyfriend and I stayed here and it was less than romantic. He did get to play in a poker tournament in the casino. That was the only highlight the hotel had while we were there. We did get a VERY cheap rate through priceline so for the price it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved hotel, not a great location or view”
Reviews.Author: M2685
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel and check in was fast. The room was nice loved it. The location was not great had a small balcony with a view of Burger King , not the greatest view from my room. However the roof pool had a much better view liked it a lot although bartender ws not so friendly at the roof pool bar. Liked the casino although one of the casino workers was not very approachable or nice.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: visusie
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel every year for the past 3 years and are going again in a couple of weeks. The rooms are very large with comfy king size bed and super soft pillows. It comes with all the ammenities and we were upgraded to a suite once (hopefully again this year). Very centrally located and convenient to everything. There's even a free trolley that runs to Old San Juan too. Staff were very helpful and the room was clean. They even give you a free newspaper every day at your door.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel...bad location”
Reviews.Author: lindacerbin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson from August 25-28. First of all, the hotel itself is nice and the executive suite was very comfortable and nice but the location is terrible (I expected tropical and it's located in the Condado area which is very city-ish and dumpy and under a lot of construction AND it is not on the beach or even near a nice beach). And second of all we had some very minor problems with our room which was not a big deal and when we told the staff they acted like we were lying which i didn't like. We ordered room service for dinner one night and I must say the food was excellent. Breakfast was the all you can eat buffet for $10.95 which was reasonable and good although I've had better, but it was worth the money and we ate a lot and even brought boxed cereal and fruit back to our room for the next morning and nobody said anything. All in all, the hotel was nice but the location was not. I would recommend staying in Isla Verde which is the more tropcial strip if staying in San Juan. I personally would never go back to San Juan again because one visit was enough.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience...Highly Recommended By Me...Will Stay Again!!”
Reviews.Author: MsBaby117
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from July 24th-31st of 2006. Before booking this hotel I got online and read the reviews... I personally can't understand the people who gave this hotel bad reviews. My stay was excellent!! Upon arrival at the hotel we were promptly checked in in a matter of minutes. Everyone was especially nice. All of the staff that we came across at the hotel was especially nice and helpful. They gave us restaurant recommendations, Suggested sites to see. Helped us figure out which busses took us where...just anything we needed!! The room was nice and neat upon arrival and within minutes of our request a refridgerator was sent to our room! The casino staff was extremely nice as was the restaurant/bar staff. The view from the balcony wasn't all that great but I personally didn't go to Puerto Rico to spend all day and night in my hotel room!! There are too many other things to do and see in Puerto Rico!!! But I will say it was nice to have the balcony to sit on in the mornings and at night.... I will definately stay at this hotel when I return to Puerto Rico!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dumpyb”
Reviews.Author: anon888888
Reviews.Content: I booked this place because I hate to turn in anything over $200/night and PR is expensive. But this place is a dump and I would try to avoid it. The Normandie which I stayed in the last go around and was quite good was only $10 more, I found out from a colleague who researched more closely. That's the way I'd go if you can. This place is like Las Vegas on a bad night and a discount package: * noisy * unattentive staff * generally junky kind of ambiance If it's the only place you kind find at a reasonable, do it. It's not complete hell, and the Internet access is actually included, which is a nice change of pace. It's around 2 blocks from a beach that is all right.

Reviews.Title: “Basic - Don't Come Here”
Reviews.Author: TheLawFamily
Reviews.Content: Hello, I came here with my husband and 3 year old to tend to some family issues. The view was of the Burger King parking lot - ok, but the toilet didn't work, and neither did the safe. The maintenance people came right away, but then the airconditioning broke down. Sigh. I went to talk to the people at the registration desk, and they were extremely embarrased and helpful. They "upgraded" us into a comfortable, clean spacious room. I go to P.R. all the time and usually stay with family. I would NOT recommend this hotel for a tourist coming to P.R. for the first or second time. I would recommend taking a cruise that stops in P.R. for the day. One can see a great amount of Old San Juan in a day and get a sense of P.R. as well. SL

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: QNeeN
Reviews.Content: The upside the rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable(select comfort air beds) the front desk help very friendly. They gave me a room upgrade to a suite which was a convienience. Its a block and a half from the beach. The pool on the roof is beautiful and affords a nice view of the ocean. my only complaint is the smoke in the lobby secondary to the casino, but once your on the elevator its not a problem! I have stayed in several hotels in Condado and was not disappointed. Remember you can't expect 5 star when your paying for 3..........I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Levi22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights while in San Juan on business. I was given an executive club suite located on the 7th floor. The room and bathroom were spotless (very important to me). It had a nice sitting area with TV, bar area, and desk with free internet. There was a balcony located off the bedroom which had some ocean views. The bed was extremely comfortable because you can adjust the firmness/softness of the bed on both sides. Included on the executive level is breakfast, hors dâ€™oeuvres at night, and on Wednesday nights there is an executive happy hour (included in price). The staff was very friendly and helpful. On the down sideâ€¦ I would not stay at this hotel if I was traveling on vacation. I didnâ€™t see anything worth writing home about. The streets and buildings are old and run down. The beaches on this end arenâ€™t the best and there isnâ€™t much to do as far as site seeing or nightlife goes. There are some restaurants on the same street, but that is about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...Not a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to PR for 5 days in the sun...the hotel wasn't bad (it was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful). The location was a block from the beach but it wasn't a great swimming beach. There are a few restaurants in walking distance but nothing spectacular and there wasn't much of a nightlife in walking distance. You could take a short taxi ride into old san juan (about $15) and enjoy all that is there. But to get to a great beach it will be about 45 minutes away. If you are going to PR for the beach I would stay in a better beach town. While in PR I would recommend a day trip to the rain forest "EL Yunque" and I would definitely go see the bioluminescent bay in Fajardo (it was amazing) but the travel agent inside the hotel was not very knowledgeable about any of these tours. They were never sure if we were definitely on the tour and the didn't know any of the details...like if we should wear our bathing suits, how long the trip would be, they even told us it wasn't worth doing the bioluminescent bay because the moon was at a bad phase but I'm so glad we decided to do it any way because it was one of the neatest things to see.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than It Looks..”
Reviews.Author: cbcito
Reviews.Content: I frequent Puerto Rico and must have passed this place on the street a million times but never had the desire to stay there. At the last minute, it was my only option so I booked it. I must give credit it's a lot better than I was expecting. I arrived early and was given a room without even asking for an early check in. I was up on the 8th floor in one of the Club rooms. It's true that the decor is on the corporate side but for the most part it's kept very well. Everything in my room was in perfect working order. The bathroom was spotless with an abundance of hot water. The beds are great, they really oughta rethink those bedspreads though. Pillows get big thumbs up. (I'm very particular about beds and pillows.) I was very into my small patio. The TV had all kinds of cool extras which I did not utilize at all, but it's the thought that counts. Every day I had a mountain of clean towels waiting when I got back from the beach. The air conditioner worked flawlessly, no noise perfect temperature. I really have no complaints about the entire weekend whatsoever for that reason I will rate it above average.

Reviews.Title: “No Sleep !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SojournerScotland
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. If you plan to have a nights sleep DO NOT GO. We had just travelled from the UK going on a cruise the following. The Band downstairs played till 3am and we got no sleep !!!!. The management were of no help. I will be complaining to Celebrity about this hotel and will never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “decent.”
Reviews.Author: CTdesigner
Reviews.Content: Being a busy 3 star hotel, we weren't expecting much but were suprised. For openers, the staff was outstanding. Everyone from the front desk management to the waitstaff was welcoming and friendly. A warm greeting at every turn. The front desk was on point and did everything they could to make sure we were happy with our room which was clean, pleasantly fresh with supplies and all appliances in working order. I think I could have brought a pet Anaconda and they would have been accomodating with a smile. The first floor is host to a casino which allows smoking so our first impression was that this hotel was kind of seedy with typical casino decor. Frankly, it is, but knowing that the staff was doing their best to make our stay enjoyable was comforting. The casino crowd seemed to be mostly locals but I found playing with them to be quite entertaining. Low minumum bets ($2 roulette) allows even the first-timer to give it a whirl. No craps table though. This is a city hotel one block from the beach surrounded by all types of cuisine and shopping at all price levels. We had some terrific meals in OSJ and Condado vicinity. The hotel breakfast isn't gourmet by any means. However, it was cheap at under $20 for the two of us w/tip and again, our waiter proved to be such a nice guy aiming to please us, we looked past it but we ate out the following morning. The pool was clean and padded loungechairs were in order with fresh towels. The gym is compact with Cybex machines, dumbbells and clean. We witnessed the attendee do a full scrub of the pool deck as well as hand-scrub every chair (Poor guy). Although, the pool bar is only open on weekends, the written pool policy was BYO unless the bar was open. Most hotels strictly enforce a "hotel products only" rule. Aside from the city hustle/bustle below, it was peaceful being high up on the sunny pool deck. Having been to the beach the previous days while at another hotel, we didn't mind the seclusion of the roof top which only had a handful of guests. Look...this hotel is surrounded by buildings on all sides so in my opinion, there isn't a great view to be had. Most rooms have a view of someone elses rooftop. I wouldn't choose to spend a week with the fam at this location but for 2 nights with my girlfriend, it was fine and allowed us to experience authentic P.R. cuisine, nightlife and shopping within easy walking distance. Otherwise, I think it is hard to find a beach in San Juan that catches the imagination to begin with so I wouldn't dock points on this hotel for its location. It is still close to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Just like a crappy Motel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed in this Hotel if you can call it that. It isnt any better than a crappy Motel. The rooms are so old and dated, the beach is not part of the hotel so you dont get the luxury of chairs and refreshments at the beach. the Pool is an ugly rectangular shaped roof top pool with no bar that is open. there is a bar set up but they never use it. There is nothing appealing about this hotel. Dont stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: tmar5918
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson on Jan. 13th and 14th. we were a little hesitant after reading some of the reviews on this sight. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and had us checked in, in no time. We got to our room and it was just as nice as any Sheraton or Marriot I have stayed in. The hotel is in a great location in a residential neighborhood about a block from the beach. Lots of restaurants and some shopping in the area. We payed under two hundred a night and this is high season, so for a hotel of this caliber it was a steal. For the person who wrote they overlooked a Burger King parking lot, what do you expect? Your in a residential neighborhood. The Marriot down the street is about a hundred more a night for the same view and if you want an ocean view at the Marriot you will pay about double what the Radisson costs. The swimming pool on the roof was peaceful and relaxing and the bar tender made the best daiquiris. All in all this is a great bargain for a pre or post cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “Substandard Radisson”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Radisson has obviously been undergoing a makeover and there is a noticeable effort to bring the hotel up to the quality level associated with the pricing. Unfortunately, it's not there yet. On the plus side, housekeeping, amenities are good. Location is excellent. However, it speaks to the business acumen that the hotel restaurant was closed during peak holiday season. The front desk really needs some training on qualities such as politeness and quality. To be fair, every time the hotel screwed up and there were some doozies, management moved fast to fix it quickly. With the exception of the check-in staff, everyone was friendly and good. This might owe more to the fact that Puerto Ricans are friendly people than the hotel itself. Overall, you won't have a bad stay, but it won't be a great stay. However this is Condado and for the strip this is one of the better hotels. As for crime concerns, the strip is safe as there is a heavy police presence and a lot of residential buildings so there are always people around. Family wise, its good because Puerto Ricans haven't lost their fondness for kids or patience for the elderly. The hotel is close to all the beaches and I walked for hours on beaches that were great. People can bring their dogs but they are well behaved and people pick up after them. All in all you stay at this hotel for the location and not for the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Radisson Ambassador”
Reviews.Author: Lisita
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a wonderful week at the Radisson. I highly recommend the suites. They are very spacious and away from any of the casino or bar noise. The staff is wonderful. Our maid left us a Christmas card and treats every day! Great restaurants nearby. I would stay away from the hotel's restaurant, until they are done with their renovations. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: operman1
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Ambassador Plaza Hotel & Casino San Juan is a great hotel to stay in for a reasonable price. The beach is only a block away and the hotel staff was very friendly to me. They surely helped me with my luggage problem. The room was very clean and the bathroom was spacious. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Precruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: dd170
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights precruise Nov 25-26th. There were 6 couples of us checking in and they told us the only way we could be on the same floor was to stay on the smoking floor. I didn't think it would work but I must say that never once did any of us smell anything. The rooms were newly decorated and smelled fresh and clean as did the hallways. I'm not a gambler, but if you are, they have a casino in the hotel. They also had a local band at night so my husband and I would go down to the little lounge and watch some of the older local folks dance. We really enjoyed it. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and I would not have a problem staying there again. Always plenty of cabs around to take you anywhere you want to go, but you can also catch the local bus for about $1.50.

Reviews.Title: “Be Very Careful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotels. I was relying on the Radisson name and thought it would be a guarantee of quality. That's not the case at this location. I paid over $250 for one night before a cruise. I was placed in accomodations badly in need of updating. The bottom of the bathtub was black with grime. There was visible mold in the bathroom and the rooms smelled of mildew. There were stains on the carpeting and the furniture. I asked for a different room and was shown 3 more that were identical to the first and in the same deplorable condition. The head housekeeper even told me that everything in the rooms needed to be ripped out and replaced, but they had not done it yet. I asked for a room that had already been updated as I have asthma and can't tolerate molds. I was told that nothing was available because the hotel was full. I called Radisson's 1-800 number because their guarantee says you don't pay if you're not satisfied. A very helpful woman at the 1-800 number secured different accomodations in the hotel for me. I was placed on the VIP floor in a room that was clean and contained no visible mold or grime. The worst part was that I had to hassle around with the desk people for about 2 hours after traveling all day and they were no help at all. While they were telling me they were all filled up and there were no avilable rooms, they were telling newly arrived people without reservations that they had rooms for them. I felt that my prepayment doomed me to a room of inferior quality. The woman at the 1-800 number said that those rooms should not even be used until renovated. The end result is that I would never again prepay for a room. This is the second time I have experienced an inferior room with prepayment and I would never again stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews but decided that this hotel was worth my time. The rooms are not wow and the view is not the best from the rooms but you have to consider that the hotel is downtown and not oceanfront. The area is very safe and there are nice stores and places to eat around. What makes this place is the staff. I love to travel and have been all over and can honestly tell you that this hotel has one of the nicest employees. From the moment I checked in they were helpful and accomodating. They went out of their way to answer any questions and give me suggestions on places to visit. I asked for suggestions on where to get typical puertorican food and they recommended a nice and inexpensive place with the best food ever - Bebo's. They even called ahead to make sure they were serving what I wanted to eat. I stayed for New Year's Eve. They had a great party. It was packed and when we requested a table once one became available, they got a table and chairs from the back so we could have a place to sit. What can I say!! Had a great time. The staff was great and I would definitely choose this hotel over other pricey ones in the Condado Area.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge level worth every cent”
Reviews.Author: Phil6184
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Radisson. I had upgraded to concierge level for an extra $30 a night and it was worth every penny. For starters, the night receptionist, Viviana is excellent at her job. She made very helpful suggestions about my short stay in San Juan. Her enthusiasm for the Island was infectious. Secondly, concierge level includes a continental breakfast, appetizers in the evening along with a self serve honor bar. If you like a cocktail before dinner, you can make your own, just the way you like it. Concierge level also includes a free in-room movie daily, but I didn't take advantage of this. The hotel seems to be popular with business people, and I met several at evening cocktails who were very friendly. For me this was a big plus. The room itself is a good size, with a king size bed, a premium mattress (select comfort) "What's your sleep number?" The bath is marble and tile. I had a balcony which did have a water view, although I had a view of a parking lot and other high rise buildings too. Ok...the hotel is not on the beach, but it is an easy 2 minute walk to the beach. if you don't like that beach, then walk in either direction until you find a nice spot. There is so much to do in Puerto Rico, I could care less we weren't directly on the beach. The tour desk arranged a tour of the rain forest. It was a fun tour, but it doesn't return until about 3 pm so pack a lunch. I was starving by the time we returned! Speaking of food, the restaurant "Yerba Buena" serves cuban food and has live entertainment far better than would be expected. Lots of fun! All in all, I had a very nice stay at the Radisson and in Puerto Rico.

HotelInfo.Name: Radisson Ambassador Plaza Hotel & Casino San Juan
